0.title: India our big brother, grateful to PM Modi: Sri Lanka's Jayasuriya amid economic crisis
0.article_body: Former Sri Lankan cricketer Sanath Jayasuriya praised India over its help to Sri Lanka amid economic crisis, saying, "As a neighbour and a big brother of our country, India has always helped us." "We're grateful to the Indian government and PM Modi," he added. India has supplied over 270,000 MT fuel to Sri Lanka to help ease the power crisis.

1.title: Twitter's next board meeting is gonna be lit: Musk on pic of himself smoking joint
1.article_body: Elon Musk on Thursday took to Twitter to share a meme that featured a picture of him smoking a joint during a podcast. The meme read, "Twitter's next board meeting is gonna be lit." Musk, who's the biggest shareholder of Twitter with a 9.1% stake in the company, has been appointed to the company's board.

2.title: 2 men enter Pune girl's house, molest her; burn her hand after resistance
2.article_body: Two men allegedly molested an 18-year-old girl after barging into her house in Pune. Police said that the accused also burned her hand with a hot frying skimmer when she tried to resist them. The men entered the girl's house saying that they wanted a water can kept inside the house. The victim reportedly lodged an FIR on Thursday morning.

3.title: BSF seizes arms, ammunition from Akhnoor International Border in Jammu
3.article_body: In a special operation, the Border Security Force (BSF) of Jammu seized a bag containing arms and ammunition at Akhnoor International Border on Thursday. The consignment was planned to be smuggled into India from Pakistan, BSF said. "BSF...recovered one AK-47 rifle, 20 AK-47 RDS, two rifle magazines, two pistols, 40 pistol RDS, and four pistol magazines," the official statement read.

4.title: Former Haryana Congress leader Nirmal Singh, daughter Chitra join AAP
4.article_body: Former Haryana Congress leader Nirmal Singh Mohra and his daughter Chitra Sarwara on Thursday joined Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) in presence of Arvind Kejriwal. "This will definitely strengthen the party," AAP leader Sushil Gupta tweeted. Singh was a two-time minister in the Haryana government and a four-time MLA from the Naggal Assembly constituency. Notably, Singh had founded Haryana Democratic Front.

5.title: Police open fire, arrest 2 for robbing, sexually abusing man in B'luru
5.article_body: Bengaluru Police on Tuesday shot two men, Mohammed Ashik and Issac, in the leg before arresting them for robbing and sexually abusing a male student last month. On March 26, Ashik and Issac along with two others kidnapped and robbed the student before forcing him to perform oral sex on them. The gang left for Udupi after the alleged crime.

6.title: Bike thief caught in Mumbai's Jogeshwari, 11 two-wheelers recovered
6.article_body: The Meghwadi Police arrested a 30-year-old man and his aide for allegedly stealing 11 bikes and a scooter from different areas of Mumbai and recovered the vehicles. The accused, who is resident of a chawl in Jogeshwari (East), had stolen six Bajaj Pulsar, one Honda Activa, one Honda Shine, one Yamaha R 15 and one Hero Honda, the police said.

7.title: Pollard must get a few more overs to bat with no Pandya brothers in MI: Aakash
7.article_body: Cricketer-turned-commentator Aakash Chopra has said all-rounder Kieron Pollard must get a few more overs to bat with no Pandya brothers in their side this season. In MI's match against KKR, Pollard scored 22* off five balls to help them post the 161-run total. In their previous two games, Pollard had scored 22 off 24 balls and three off six balls.

8.title: Selectors would be worried: Jaffer on Rohit Sharma's 12-ball 3 vs KKR
8.article_body: Reacting to MI captain Rohit Sharma scoring 54 runs in three IPL 2022 matches having been dismissed for 3 runs off 12 balls against KKR, ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer said the selectors would be worried about his form. "The rhythm is missing," added Jaffer. "This is a really weak MI bowling attack in spite of Jasprit Bumrah," stated Jaffer.

9.title: COVID-19 increases risk of blood clots for up to 6 months: Study
9.article_body: COVID-19 can increase the risk of serious blood clots for up to six months after infection, a new Sweden study suggested. Researchers from Umea University tracked the health of over one million people who had tested positive for COVID-19 between February 2020 and May 2021 in Sweden and compared them with more than four million people who didn't test positive.

10.title: Flipkart planning US listing in 2023 at $60-70 bn valuation: Report
10.article_body: Flipkart has pushed its IPO valuation target to around $60-70 billion, and is now planning a US listing in 2023 instead of 2022, Reuters reported citing sources. Some sources reportedly said that the ongoing conflict between Russia and Ukraine played a part in Flipkart delaying its plans. Others said Flipkart's internal plan to boost valuations further caused the delay.

11.title: Minor among 2 arrested for stealing 26 vehicles in Ahmedabad
11.article_body: The Ahmedabad Policeâ€™s Detection of Crime Branch (DCB) arrested two persons, including a juvenile, for allegedly stealing around 26 autorickshaws and two-wheelers in the city. The accused were held near Naroda Patiya with a stolen autorickshaw. "We recovered 21 autorickshaws and five motorcycles which were stolen from different areas of Ahmedabad," DP Chudasma, ACP, DCB Ahmedabad, said.

12.title: Rana fined 10% of match fee, Bumrah also reprimanded for breaching IPL Code of Conduct
12.article_body: KKR's Nitish Rana has been reprimanded and fined 10% of his match fee for breaching the IPL Code of Conduct during the MI-KKR match on Wednesday. MI's Jasprit Bumrah was also reprimanded but wasn't fined. Both the players admitted to the Level 1 offence of the code, IPL said. However, the IPL press release did not specify the breaches.

13.title: Plate put in ex-India cricketer Contractor's head after bouncer removed after 60 years
13.article_body: The metal plate inserted in ex-India batter Nari Contractor's head through surgery after he suffered a fracture following a bouncer by ex-West Indies pacer Charlie Griffith in 1962 has been removed. "The skin was disintegrating on the plate. So he had lost the skin covering it...hence it was advised by the doctors to get it removed," Contractor's son Hoshedar said.

14.title: 2 killed, 1 injured as cooking gas cylinder explodes in UP's Ballia
14.article_body: At least two people, aged 40 and 20, were killed and one was injured as a cooking gas cylinder exploded in Uttar Pradesh's Ballia, police said. The cylinder caught fire while they were cooking, police added. All the victims used to work at a petrol pump and were living together in rented accommodation, police further said.

15.title: Adani Group becomes 3rd Indian group to cross $200 billion in market value
15.article_body: Billionaire Gautam Adani-led Adani Group has become India's third conglomerate to cross a market capitalisation of $200 billion. On Thursday, the group's market value stood at $201 billion as the shares of five of its seven listed firms hit all-time highs, according to BSE data. Earlier, Tata Group ($320 billion) and Mukesh Ambani's Reliance Group ($237 billion) achieved this milestone.

16.title: Akhilesh, SP sympathise with terrorists: Maurya on Gorakhnath temple attack
16.article_body: A day after Akhilesh Yadav accused BJP of exaggeration in the Gorakhnath temple attack case, UP Deputy CM Keshav Prasad Maurya said, "Akhilesh Ji and SP have always been linked to terrorists." "I condemn his attempts to boost morale of terrorists," he added. "Our security personnel caught him by risking their lives...his statement is cheap and deplorable," he further said.

17.title: Hrithik and rumoured girlfriend Saba pose with Sussanne and her rumoured boyfriend
17.article_body: A picture of Hrithik Roshan and rumoured girlfriend Saba Azad posing with the actor's ex-wife Sussanne Khan and her rumoured boyfriend Arslan Goni has gone viral. The picture was shared by Sussanne on Instagram along with the caption, "The most precious blessing of life is to be relentlessly surrounded by the best energy."

18.title: Central government must take price rise seriously: Mayawati
18.article_body: Bahujan Samaj Party chief Mayawati on Thursday said central government must take the issue of price rise seriously. "People were already reeling under the stress of high inflation, unemployment and poverty when they were hit by...rise in prices of petrol, diesel, cooking gas and other essential items," she tweeted. Notably, fuel prices were hiked for the 14th time on Wednesday.

19.title: New cell discovered in human lungs that may treat respiratory disease
19.article_body: Scientists discovered a new type of cell named respiratory airway secretory cells (RASCs) in human lungs that could help in treating chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD). These cells have a regenerative ability that could replenish other cells implicated in COPD, which facilitate normal functioning of alveoli. RASCs are found in tiny airway branches near alveoli air sacs in the lungs.

20.title: Auto driver who knocked down traffic police officer in Chennai held
20.article_body: An auto-rickshaw driver, who knocked down a police officer during a vehicle-checking drive in Chennai, was arrested on Wednesday, three days after he went absconding. The driver, Sudharshan, had hit sub-inspector Pon Raj while he was engaged in a vehicle-checking drive on Mount Poonamallee Road. The police have now seized his vehicle and will soon take him into custody.

21.title: 1994 rape victim's son files complaint, DNA test exposes accused 28 yrs later
21.article_body: Police have identified two brothers as accused in 28-year-old rape case in Uttar Pradesh through a DNA test. Brothers had reportedly raped a woman, who was 12 years old then. The woman delivered baby boy but was forced to give him up. She met her son in 2020 who urged her to fight for justice and filed complaint against accused.

22.title: You may be a king, but if soldiers are weak, you'll lose: Kaif on MI's defeats
22.article_body: After MI lost their third straight game in the ongoing IPL season, ex-India batter Mohammad Kaif said, "You may be a big king, but if your soldiers are weak then you will lose the battle." He added, "The skill level of MI bowlers isn't that high this season...the team put together at the auction was not up to the mark."

23.title: I may be raided or booked: Bengaluru ex-police chief after joining AAP
23.article_body: Days after joining the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP), former Bengaluru Police Commissioner Bhaskar Rao said that raids may be conducted against him or cases may be registered. Rao added he is "ready to face them". "Our leader Arvind Kejriwal has done many sacrifices...faced many challenges. Whoever treads on the path of reform in society faces many...challenges," he further said.

24.title: Smoking during pregnancy may not cause ADHD in children: Study
24.article_body: A systematic review and meta-analysis of 46 prior studies showed though smoking during pregnancy is associated with offspring attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) it's unlikely to cause it. "Our...review shows...there's no causal effect between maternal prenatal smoking and offspring ADHD diagnosis. However, pregnant women should still...not...smoke," the lead author of the study said.

25.title: News article calls Musk's Twitter stake 'bad news' for free speech, he laughs
25.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk laughed in response to a Washington Post article that said his Twitter stake is "bad news" for free speech. "WaPo always good for a laugh," Musk said. Pointing to Musk's stake, Amazon's Jeff Bezos-owned Washington Post had written, "When you're the world's richest human you can toss billions around like poker chips."

26.title: Heavy rains cause flash floods in Sydney, evacuation ordered
26.article_body: The Australian authorities asked thousands of people to evacuate their homes after torrential rain caused flash floods along the country's east coast. Sydney reportedly received a month's rain overnight leading to waterlogged streets, fallen power lines and uprooted trees. Sharp, short bursts of rain have been creating flash flooding almost every hour, said an emergency services official.

27.title: Delhi Police to integrate its licensing services with DigiLocker
27.article_body: Delhi Police will soon integrate its licensing unit with DigiLocker through National eGovernance Division (NeGD) in order to provide improved services to citizens. "The law enforcement agencies too will have an authentic source to verify such licenses," said OP Mishra, Joint Commissioner of Police (licensing). DCP Rakesh Asthana has also given his in-principle approval for the proposal, he added.

28.title: Constable, his brother shoot father, son dead over monetary dispute in UP
28.article_body: A constable and his brother allegedly held hostage, tortured and shot dead a 45-year-old man and his 20-year-old son over a monetary dispute in Uttar Pradesh's Shamli, police said. The man had taken money from the constable on the pretext of providing a job, police added. Their bodies were later found in a tube well, police further said.

29.title: US sanctions on banks blow to ordinary citizens: Russia
29.article_body: US sanctions against Sberbank and Alfabank banks are a "direct blow to the Russian population [and] ordinary citizens", TASS news agency cited Russia's US Ambassador Anatoly Antonov as saying. Sberbank holds a third of Russia's total banking assets, while Alfabank is the fourth largest financial institution in the country. The sanctions were imposed in response to Moscow's invasion of Ukraine.

30.title: Meta cancels F8 developer event as it focuses on building metaverse
30.article_body: Facebook-parent Meta has cancelled its annual developer conference 'F8' this year. "We are taking a brief break...while we gear up on new initiatives that are all tailored towards the next chapter of the internet...building the metaverse," the firm said. Meta added that it will still be holding its inaugural Conversations conference on May 19.

31.title: Ab nani yaad aayegi: Ashneer to BharatPe's CEO, Chairman on 'degrowth' quarter
31.article_body: Ashneer Grover, who recently quit from BharatPe, tweeted, "So I...heard BharatPe closed its first quarter of 'degrowth'...under able (sic) leadership of Rajnish Kumar (board Chairman) and Suhail Sameer (CEO)." "Ab nani (grandmother) yaad aayegi," he wrote. "Chaabi chheenna and hatti chalana do alag alag skills hai! (Snatching a key and running an elephant are two separate skills)," he added.

32.title: Yo Yo Honey Singh manhandled by 4-5 men at club in Delhi, says one man was armed
32.article_body: A complaint has been filed by singer Yo Yo Honey Singh against a group of four to five unidentified men after he was allegedly manhandled during his performance at a club in Delhi on March 27. Singh said that one of the men was armed. The men started misbehaving and disrupted the show, the complaint read.

33.title: Fox attacks US Congressman; Capitol Hill put on alert
33.article_body: The authorities sounded an alert after US Congressman Ami Bera was attacked by a fox while walking to the Capitol in Washington DC. Bera said he was attacked from behind by what he initially thought was a dog but turned out to be a fox. He fought the animal using his umbrella for about 15 seconds.

34.title: Rohit fans cool down: Virender Sehwag on being criticised over 'vada pav' tweet
34.article_body: After being criticised by Rohit Sharma fans over his tweet following MI's loss against KKR, Virender Sehwag urged them to cool down. "Moonh se nivala cheen liya...sorry vada pav cheen liya," Sehwag had tweeted while praising Pat Cummins for scoring 15-ball 56*. "Vada pav reference is for Mumbai...a city which thrives on vada pav. Rohit fans thanda lo," Sehwag clarified.

35.title: Over 12 maggots removed from man's eye in France; pic surfaces
35.article_body: Doctors in France reported a rare case of tiny sheep bot fly larvae, also known as maggots, infesting the outer surface of a man's eyeball. Doctors removed more than a dozen maggots from outside the eyeball and surrounding tissue, according to the report in The New England Journal of Medicine. Doctors had to pluck the maggots out using forceps.

36.title: Russian women film themselves cutting Chanel bags as brand stops selling to them
36.article_body: Several wealthy Russian women and influencers have been filming themselves cutting their Chanel bags with a pair of scissors after the brand pulled out of Russia and stopped selling to Russians abroad. "I am against Russophobia...If owning Chanel means selling my Motherland, then I don't need Chanel," TV presenter and actress Marina Ermoshkina said, cutting her bag.

37.title: Greater Noida increases land rates up to 25% in residential category
37.article_body: The Greater Noida Industrial Development Authority (GNIDA) has increased the land allotment rates up to 25% which is between â‚¹5,000-â‚¹7,000 per square metre for residential plots for FY 2022-23. The new rates per square metre of land will be â‚¹39,000 for category A, â‚¹36,000 for category B, â‚¹34,000 for category C and â‚¹29,000 for category D, the GNIDA said.

38.title: Over 80% kids with autism, cerebral palsy found depressed in Bihar
38.article_body: After check-ups held by Bihar health department organised in collaboration with NGOs, over 80% of the children with autism, cerebral palsy, and other disabilities have been found to be under stress and depression. "Majority of them had been going through mental stress because of confinement caused by...pandemic and lockdown. They need outdoor activities," founder of Special Olympics Bihar, said.

39.title: Rule of law supreme: Owaisi to T'gana govt after GHMC corporator's arrest
39.article_body: AIMIM chief and Hyderabad MP Asaduddin Owaisi criticised the ruling Telangana Rashtra Samithi (TRS) and said that rule of law is supreme in Article 13 of the Constitution. This comes after one of his party's GHMC corporators, Mohammed Ghousuddin, was arrested for allegedly obstructing policemen. Owaisi was responding to a Hyderabad Police's tweet about a raid at a pub.

40.title: Intel India revs up growth & hiring to capture global opportunities
40.article_body: Intel is the only semiconductor company with the depth & breadth of intelligent silicon, software & hardware to fuel next-gen innovations. Holding this view, Intel commits to advancing its leadership by attracting the best talent. Intel India is offering competitive benefits like dual bonuses based on performance & profitability, restricted stock units for employees across all levels, and others.

41.title: LSG have too many bowling options, it can give headache to Rahul: Watson
41.article_body: DC's assistant coach Shane Watson has said LSG have too many bowling options and this could be a "big headache" for their captain KL Rahul. "It can be difficult to decide how you're going to give everyone a go...But at the moment, they have all the bases covered," he added. LSG played three all-rounders in their last game against SRH.

42.title: School teacher, her partner sexually assault teenagers in TN; arrested
42.article_body: A 45-year-old government school teacher and her 39-year-old partner have been arrested for allegedly sexually assaulting three teenagers, including the woman's son aged 19, near Tamil Nadu's Madurai on Wednesday. "We came to know about it (the assault) after some of the photos and videos they shot were leaked and started circulating in the locality," police said.

43.title: Bitter pill to swallow: Shastri on MI's loss with 4 overs left vs KKR
43.article_body: Reacting to MI's defeat against KKR with four overs left having conceded 162 runs in 16 overs, Ravi Shastri said the loss is a bitter pill to swallow, adding that it was bizarre. "It's like...[being given] a chocolate and before you can say thank you, it's in the other guy's mouth and he's saying thank you," added Shastri.

44.title: Shaw has to improve execution, got out playing pull shot twice: Watson
44.article_body: DC assistant coach Shane Watson said Prithvi Shaw has to improve his execution of shots, adding that he has been dismissed playing the pull shot in both IPL 2022 matches played by the franchise. DC head coach Ricky Ponting had earlier said he will speak to Shaw about his dismissals. Shaw has scored 48 runs in two IPL 2022 matches.

45.title: Saw Baahubali 2 and thought 'Oh my god, how do you up that': Karan on Rajamouli
45.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar said that he feels that filmmaker SS Rajamouli "cannot be real". "When I first saw 'Baahubali' I thought I had never seen something like that...Then I saw 'Baahubali 2' and I thought 'Oh my God! How do you up that?'. Then you see 'RRR' and you're like this is too good to be true," Karan added.

46.title: Criminal Procedure Bill violates dignity: P Chidambaram
46.article_body: Congress MP P Chidambaram has termed theÂ Criminal Procedure (Identification) Bill, 2022,Â as "unconstitutional". "It (the Bill) violates liberty, privacy and dignity of people. The Bill was not referred to a select committee," Chidambaram said on Wednesday while speaking in the Rajya Sabha during the second part of the Budget Session of Parliament.

47.title: Gautam Adani becomes world's 6th richest person: Forbes
47.article_body: India's richest man and Adani Group Chairman Gautam Adani has become the world's sixth richest person with a net worth of $116.6 billion, as per Forbes' real-time billionaires list. He surpassed Oracle Co-founder Larry Ellison and Google's Founder Sergey Brin and Larry Page to reach the spot. Meanwhile, Reliance Industries' Chairman remained the world's 10th richest person, as per Forbes.

48.title: CAG flags flaws in project to build roads along Indo-Nepal border
48.article_body: A Comptroller and Auditor General (CAG) report pointed out several flaws in a project to build over 1,300 km of roads along the Indo-Nepal border. The report, which was tabled in Parliament, highlighted poor design, cost overruns and delays. The home ministry failed to ensure that land acquisition and forest clearances were taken in time, said the report.

49.title: Take care of WB, its debt almost equal to Sri Lanka: BJP to Mamata
49.article_body: Reacting to Mamata Banerjee's "India's financial condition worse than Sri Lanka" remark, BJP's Sukanta Majumdar said, "she should take care of her state as its debt is almost equal to Sri Lanka." "Sri Lanka's total debt was â‚¹6 lakh crore and Bengal's debt is â‚¹5.62 lakh crore. Had Bengal been a separate country, its condition would've been worse," Majumdar said.

50.title: No takers for KCRâ€™s third front idea: Telangana BJP chief
50.article_body: Telangana BJP chief Bandi Sanjay has said that CM K Chandrashekar Rao's idea of a third front in national politics will not be accepted by other parties. "There are no takers for KCR's third front idea. He has no credibility among the other parties and nobody believes him," he said. Sanjay added that Rao treats his political adversaries with contempt.

51.title: AK-47 rifle, magazine seized from Agartala bound train in Assam
51.article_body: The Railway Protection Force and Government Railway Police recovered an AK-47 rifle and a magazine from an Agartala bound train in Assam's Hojai district. "When...security personnel asked a man sitting nearby about [a suspicious] bag, he said it is a blanket and...jumped off the train," an official said. Police have checked CCTV footage to trace the man, the official added.

52.title: CNG price hiked by â‚¹2.5 per kg in Delhi, to now cost â‚¹69.11 per kg
52.article_body: The Indraprastha Gas Limited (IGL) has hiked the price of Compressed Natural Gas (CNG) in Delhi by â‚¹2.5 per kg from Thursday. CNG will now cost â‚¹69.11 per kg in the national capital after an increase by over â‚¹9 in six days. The CNG price in Noida, Greater Noida and Ghaziabad has been hiked to â‚¹71.67 per kg.

53.title: Kya kar loge: Amitabh Bachchan to trolls on promoting son Abhishek's film 'Dasvi'
53.article_body: Actor Amitabh Bachchan, in an apparent response to people trolling him for promoting his son Abhishek Bachchan's film 'Dasvi', tweeted, "Ji haan huzoor. Mai karta hu: Badhai, Prachar, Manglachar! Kya kar loge? (Yes sir, I do: congratulations, promotions, invocations!!! What will you do?)" Recently, Amitabh had praised the trailer of the film, which released today.

54.title: Ukraine can absolutely win war, Putin has achieved zero objectives: US
54.article_body: The US has said that Ukraine can "absolutely" win the war against Russia.  "And if you look at what they have been able to do just thus far, [Russian President] Vladimir Putin has achieved exactly zero of his strategic objectives inside Ukraine. He didn't take Kyiv...topple the government...[or] remove Ukraine as a nation-state," Pentagon Press Secretary John Kirby said.

55.title: Real Madrid beat Chelsea, Bayern suffer loss in Champions League last-8 1st leg
55.article_body: Real Madrid and Villarreal secured wins in their respective first legs of the Champions League quarterfinals as they defeated Chelsea and Bayern Munich respectively on Wednesday night. Madrid secured a 3-1 win over the defending champions after striker Karim Benzema scored a hat-trick. Arnaut Danjuma scored the only goal in Villarreal's victory over Munich.

56.title: Some people like fighting: Supreme Court on 60 cases between husband and wife in 41 years
56.article_body: Reacting to filing of 60 cases against each other by a husband and wife in 41 years, including 11 years of separation, the Supreme Court said, "Some people like fighting." It added, "They want to always be in court. If they don't see court...they don't get sleep." The court referred the parties for mediation, adding that it's a "time-bound process".

57.title: Need to prepare youth to become job creators, not job seekers: Pradhan
57.article_body: Union Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan on Wednesday said there is a need to prepare the youth of the country to become job creators rather than job seekers. "If students only want to become employees, nothing will happen. This country will become a consuming economy. There is a need to make it an employer economy," Pradhan added.

58.title: Wild elephant attacks bus, breaks its windshield in Kerala; video surfaces
58.article_body: A wild elephant who is reportedly known as 'Padayappa' in Kerala's Munnar attacked a KSRTC bus and broke its windshield glass on Wednesday evening. A video of the incident was shared on Twitter by IAS officer Supriya Sahu. Reports said the bus had 50 passengers onboard and was on its way from Munnar to Udumalpet when incident took place.

59.title: Madras HC upholds TN govt's 7.5% quota to govt school students in medical courses
59.article_body: Madras HC upheld the Tamil Nadu government's decision to give 7.5% reservation to government school students in admission to undergraduate medical courses. "We direct the state to review the quota in five years...steps may be taken to improve the standard of education in government schools so that the reservation may not be further extended beyond five years," the HC said.

60.title: India's first underwater metro tunnel in Kolkata to be ready in 2023
60.article_body: The construction of India's first underwater tunnel in Kolkata under the Hooghly river that will connect Howrah and Kolkata through metro will be made fully functional by 2023. The tunnel corridor is built 33 metres below the riverbed. "Important passage work has...been done...if a technical problem arises...passengers can be taken out through the special passage," the site supervisor said.

61.title: Musk will push Twitter execs to pick up pace: Ex-Tesla board member
61.article_body: Former Tesla board member Steve Westly has advised Twitter executives to put on their track shoes because Tesla CEO Elon Musk is "going to push you to pick up the pace". "Here we are day one...and he's already saying 'Hey, maybe it's time to get that edit function in there.' I think he's going to shake things up," Westly added.

62.title: Reconsider travel to Sri Lanka: US to its citizens amid crisis
62.article_body: Amid the ongoing economic crisis in Sri Lanka, the US has advised its citizens against travelling to the island nation, citing fuel and medicine shortages and COVID-19. The US State Department also warned citizens to "exercise increased caution in Sri Lanka due to terrorism". "Terrorists may attack with little or no warning, targeting tourist places...hotels...and other public areas," it added.

63.title: Pay heed to accused's mental condition: Akhilesh on Gorakhnath temple attack
63.article_body: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav accused BJP of exaggerating the Gorakhnath Temple attack case and asked the authorities to pay heed to accused's mental condition while probing the matter. "His (accused) father said he has a psychiatric problem, dealing with bipolar issue, I feel we need to pay heed to that as well...BJP is a party that exaggerates," Yadav said.

64.title: Govt is working tirelessly to augment Indiaâ€™s health infrastructure: PM Modi
64.article_body: On the occasion of World Health Day on Thursday, Prime Minister Narendra Modi took to Twitter and said the government is working tirelessly to augment India's health infrastructure. "The focus is on ensuring good quality and affordable healthcare to our citizens," he added. "Our focus on affordable healthcare has ensured significant savings for the poor and middle class," he said.

65.title: Man from Liberia held at Delhi airport with cocaine worth â‚¹89.74 crore
65.article_body: A man from Liberia, carrying 5.9 kilograms of cocaine worth â‚¹89.74 crore, was arrested by customs officials at Delhi's Indira Gandhi International Airport, as per an official statement. As many as eight packets of off-white and white coloured substances, suspected to be narcotics, in his trolley bag were recovered. The accused was travelling to Delhi from Lagos via Doha.

66.title: No one treated me differently: 'Jalsa' actor on shooting with cerebral palsy
66.article_body: Jalsa actor Surya Kasibhatla, who suffers from cerebral palsy said that no one from the team treated him differently. "I was one among them...I was absolutely comfortable while shooting for 'Jalsa'. Right from my travel logistics to accommodation, food, local travel, everything was seamless experience...The entire cast and crew made sure I am always comfortable and at ease," he added.

67.title: Who are Russian President Vladimir Putin's daughters facing US sanctions?
67.article_body: The US, which imposed sanctions on Russian President Vladimir Putin's daughters, identified them as Katerina Tikhonova and Maria Vorontsova. Vorontsova, Putin and his then-wife Lyudmila Shkrebneva's elder daughter, is a paediatric endocrinologist, specialising in genetics and dwarfism, The Independent reported. Katerina, their second-born, is an academic and an ex-acrobatic rock 'n' roll dancer.

68.title: Sania Mirza said my son should become a cricketer, but I don't want him to: Sarfaraz
68.article_body: Ex-Pakistan captain Sarfaraz Ahmed said several people, including Sania Mirza, suggested that his son Abdullah should become a cricketer, but he doesn't want him to pursue it. He added, "Being a cricketer...I suffered many things that I don't want Abdullah to face. It's human nature. Being a cricketer, I want my brother or son to be selected immediately. Otherwise...it hurts."

69.title: I was going through something in my personal life, was depressed: Uthappa on RCB days
69.article_body: CSK batter Robin Uthappa has revealed that he was completely into depression during his first season with RCB in 2009 as he was going through something in his personal life. He added, "I didn't play well even for one game that season." Uthappa was transferred from MI to RCB after the inaugural season of IPL in 2008.

70.title: Today, it is very hard for me to call him Mahi bhai: Robin Uthappa on MS Dhoni
70.article_body: Talking about his friendship with MS Dhoni, CSK batter Robin Uthappa said, "Today...it's very hard for me to call him Mahi bhai because when I got to know him he was Mahi, MS." Uthappa added, "I played with him after 10+ years. I asked him, 'What should I call you?' He [said], 'Call me...MS or Mahi or however you want'."

71.title: All secular forces need to come together to defeat BJP: Yechury
71.article_body: CPI(M) leader Sitaram Yechury on Wednesday urged all the secular and democratic forces to come together to defeat BJP. "All secular forces should come together to dump the party driven by the Hindutva ideology," Yechury added. "It (BJP) has to be isolated and defeated. It is undermining all the constitutional bodies and selling off PSUs one by one," Yechury stated.

72.title: One person arrested for duping over 250 job aspirants in Lucknow
72.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Special Task Force (STF) on Wednesday arrested one person for allegedly duping over 250 job aspirants in Lucknow. The accused, identified as Prateek Mishra, posed as an IAS/IPS officer and duped job seekers on pretext of providing them jobs in the Anti-Terrorism Squad (ATS). The STF recovered fake IPS ID card and appointment letters from the accused.

73.title: Vigilance bureau books 2 Punjab Police officials for taking bribe of over â‚¹1.5 lakh
73.article_body: Two Punjab Police officials were booked in Ferozepur for allegedly taking over â‚¹1.5 lakh as a bribe from a man after the audio recording of the incident was submitted to the vigilance bureau. The duo had seized 4 kg of poppy husk from the complainantâ€™s father last year. Later, they threatened the complainant.

74.title: Political messages on answer papers will invite penal action: WB education council
74.article_body: Students who write political messages or drawings on their Class 12 exams answer papers will invite penal action, West Bengal Council of Higher Secondary Education (WBCHSE) said. "Examiners...instructed not to evaluate such answer papers," WBCHSE added. This comes after examiners found that a number of students, appearing for Class 10 exams conducted earlier, wrote 'Khela Hobe' on answer papers.

75.title: India's power grid targeted by suspected Chinese hackers near Ladakh: Report
75.article_body: Suspected China-backed hackers targeted India's power sector in recent months under an apparent cyber-espionage campaign, as per US-based threat intelligence firm Recorded Future. The hackers focused on around seven "load dispatch" centres that disperse electricity in areas near the India-China border in Ladakh, it said. They reportedly compromised an Indian national emergency response system.

76.title: If Venkatesh didn't have Cummins at the other end, KKR would've lost: Jaffer
76.article_body: Ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer has said KKR would've lost to MI had Pat Cummins not smashed the joint-fastest fifty in IPL history. "Venkatesh Iyer was finding it hard to time the ball even though he got fifty. If Iyer didn't have Cummins at the other end, KKR might not have won," he stated. Cummins scored 56* off 15 against MI.

77.title: E-commerce firm JD.com's founder steps down as CEO after 19 yrs
77.article_body: Chinese e-commerce giant JD.com's Founder Richard Liu has stepped down as the CEO of the firm after 19 years. Company president Lei Xu has been appointed as the new CEO. Liu will stay on as chairman of the Beijing-headquartered firm. Xu, who has been at the firm for over 10 years, will also join the board as an executive director.

78.title: Mumbai woman trying to file complaint against auto driver loses â‚¹1 lakh
78.article_body: A 51-year-old Mumbai woman lost nearly â‚¹1 lakh while trying to register complaint against an auto driver. The woman was left midway by the auto driver, following which she began looking for the cab aggregator's customer care number and contacted a fraudulent number, police said. However, on pretext of providing a refund, the executive siphoned off money from her account.

79.title: 60% of Delhi traffic police personnel suffer from hypertension: Report
79.article_body: Nearly 60% of the 5,500 traffic police personnel in Delhi suffer from hypertension, according to reports of their medical check-ups conducted in February this year. Further, 20% of them have diabetes while 10% have hearing problems, the reports added. Direct exposure to air and noise pollution, job stress and irregular sleep were cited as reasons for these medical conditions.

80.title: Ex-police officer alleges attack by car recovery agents in Ahmedabad
80.article_body: Retired SP, Narendra K Amin, filed a police complaint in Ahmedabad claiming that he was allegedly attacked by four recovery agents who claimed to be from the crime branch and tried to seize his car. Amin also accused his two former business associates of fraud. He claimed that the car was under Preeti Dalal's name, his former business associate.

81.title: Haryana Education Minister should be sacked: Surjewala on paper leak
81.article_body: After reports that five question papers of the Haryana Board's Class 10 and 12 were leaked, Congress General Secretary Randeep Singh Surjewala demanded the removal of Haryana Education Minister Kanwar Pal. Surjewala criticised the Haryana government, saying that Khattar-Chautala government is responsible for "ruining" the education system in the state and making students dependent on the "copying mafia".

82.title: Married 3 months ago, Guj man killed for objecting to comments on wife
82.article_body: Shabbir Lalpariya from Gujarat, who got married three months ago, was stabbed to death after he got into fight as four men teased his wife. Prime accused Zuber's cousin brother Mohsin passed objectionable comments at Shabbir's wife, after which Shabbir and Mohsin got into argument. Later, Zuber slapped Shabbir in Chandni Bazaar, where Shabbir was also stabbed multiple times.

83.title: Russia must not win the war against Ukraine: German Chancellor
83.article_body: Addressing the lawmakers in the federal Parliament, German Chancellor Olaf Scholz on Wednesday said, "It has to remain our goal that Russia does not win this war [against Ukraine]." Speaking of the reported war crimes by Russian forces, Scholz said, "The perpetrators and those who commissioned them have to be held accountable."

84.title: We got behind in first 10 overs while batting: MI coach Jayawardena
84.article_body: Talking about their defeat against KKR, MI head coach Mahela Jayawardena said they knew it'll be "hard to work through" the initial overs but they took a little more time to establish themselves as they kept losing wickets. "I thought we built it up nicely...[but then] got behind in first 10 overs," he added. MI were 54/2 after 10 overs.

85.title: Pune witnesses hottest day of year at 40.1Â°C
85.article_body: Pune on Wednesday witnessed its hottest day of the year at 40.1 degrees Celsius. As per the forecast of the India Meteorological Department (IMD), the city will experience similar hot days ahead this week. Reportedly, the minimum temperatures in Pune have remained between 18 and 26 degrees Celsius, which were significantly above normal for April.

86.title: US man who lived in daughter's dorm convicted of abusing her friends
86.article_body: A 62-year-old US man, Lawrence Ray, was convicted of exploiting his daughter's college friends for years by using threats and violence to make himself rich. Ray met the students when he moved into his daughter's dorm in a New York college after completing a prison stint. Found guilty on 15 counts, the convict faces life in prison.

87.title: Boy kills father over fear of being 'thrown out' if he fails in exams in MP
87.article_body: A 15-year-old boy killed his 46-year-old father with an axe over the fear of being "thrown out" if he fails in Class 10 exams in Madhya Pradesh's Guna, police said. He burnt his fingers so that his fingerprints on the axe don't match, police added. The boy had not prepared for the exams and feared failing, police further said.

88.title: Asked to stop spitting, man assaults 18-yr-old on Thane local
88.article_body: A 33-year-old man allegedly beat up an 18-year-old boy after the teenager asked him to stop spitting from the footboard of Titwala-bound local train in Thane on Tuesday. The man started assaulting the teenager on the moving train for teaching him cleanliness. Later, he got down at next station and beat up the boy again with a stone, police said.

89.title: Warren Buffett's Berkshire reveals 11.4% stake in HP worth $4.2 bn
89.article_body: Billionaire Warren Buffett-led Berkshire Hathaway has disclosed its purchase of nearly 121 million shares of HP, giving it a roughly 11.4% stake worth about $4.2 billion. HP shares jumped nearly 10% to $38.38 in after-hours trading after Berkshire disclosed the stake in SEC filings. In March, Berkshire agreed to buy insurance company Alleghany for $11.6 billion in cash.

90.title: After Delhi, Punjab, itâ€™s Himachalâ€™s turn to see a revolution: Kejriwal
90.article_body: After Delhi and Punjab, itâ€™s Himachal Pradeshâ€™s turn to bring in a revolution, AAP national convenor Arvind Kejriwal said on Wednesday. Kejriwal and Punjab CM  Bhagwant Mann led a roadshow in Himachalâ€™s Mandi ahead of state Assembly polls. "We don't know how to do politics but we certainly know how to build schools and hospitals and eradicate corruption," Kejriwal added.

91.title: Simon Doull clarifies his 'social media star' statement on RR's Riyan Parag
91.article_body: Commentator Simon Doull clarified after a Twitter user criticised him for saying, "I know [RR all-rounder] Riyan Parag is a social media star...but that doesn't count in a match." "Social media says...he's popular...but that doesn't count when he's in...middle...Runs and strike rate is his currency and IMO it's not good enough. Maybe it's lost in translation a little...sorry," Doull wrote.

92.title: Won't fill petrol for less than â‚¹50: Maharashtra petrol pump's notice amid rising prices
92.article_body: A petrol pump in Maharashtra's Nagpur has refused to sell petrol for less than â‚¹50 amid rising prices. "It's not viable to operate machines for giving such...small quantity of petrol as they consume high electricity. We took this decision to avoid...scuffle," the petrol pump owner said. "When drivers ask for petrol worth â‚¹20-â‚¹30...machine hits the amount within seconds," he added.

93.title: Ensured to not go overboard, Madhuri can't look vulgar: Indra on 'Dhak Dhak..'
93.article_body: 'Beta' director Indra Kumar said that the team ensured that they do not go overboard with the song 'Dhak Dhak Karne Laga'. "The idea [was] it should not be vulgar...And we succeeded. Families  watched it together....We ensured that we should not go overboard. Madhuri [Dixit] anyway is so graceful. She can't ever look vulgar, " Indra added.

94.title: 33-year-old man held with mephedrone worth â‚¹27.2 lakh in Pune
94.article_body:
Police have arrested a 33-year-old man with at least 272 grams of mephedrone worth â‚¹27.2 lakh in Pune's Pimpri-Chinchwad. The accused, Nadim Inayat Patel, was reportedly intercepted by police at Sudhavadi in Maval on Tuesday at 11:15 pm, following a tip-off. Along with the contraband, police 
also seized a four-wheeler vehicle and two cell phones from the accused.

95.title: India sends 270,000 MT of petrol, diesel to Sri Lanka amid its economic crisis
95.article_body: India has supplied more than 270,000 MT of petrol and diesel to Sri Lanka so far under a credit line to help ease the power crisis amid the country's worst economic crisis in decades. "One consignment each of 36,000 MT petrol and 40,000 MT diesel was delivered to SriLanka in the last 24 hours," India High Commission in Colombo tweeted.

96.title: Man who bought NFT of world's first-ever tweet for $2.9 mn is reselling it for $48 mn
96.article_body: A non-fungible token (NFT) of the world's first-ever tweet is being resold for $48 million. The tweet, which read "just setting up my twttr", was sent by Twitter Co-founder Jack Dorsey in 2006. Malaysia-based Sina Estavi, CEO of blockchain service Bridge Oracle purchased the NFT for $2.9 million in March 2021. Estavi said he'd donate 50% of proceeds to charity.

97.title: AAP Youth Wing leader arrested for assaulting policemen in Gujarat
97.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) Youth Wing leader Yuvrajsinh Jadeja was arrested for allegedly assaulting policemen and dragging a constable on his car's bonnet in Gujarat's Gandhinagar, police said. "We had detained 55 Vidyasahayak recruitment protesters ...Jadeja had followed them...assaulted policemen present over there," police added. "BJP government framed him in a fake case," Gujarat AAP chief said.

98.title: Extraordinary! I couldn't believe the way Cummins was hitting: Shreyas
98.article_body: KKR captain Shreyas Iyer said he couldn't believe the way pacer Pat Cummins was hitting the ball during their match against MI, which they won by five wickets. "Extraordinary!...because in the nets, he was getting bowled now and then," added Shreyas. "The plan was for Venkatesh to drop anchor and tell Pat to just swing at everything," he further said.

99.title: Haryana man kills 13-yr-old daughter over suspicion of love affair
99.article_body: A man allegedly strangulated his 13-year-old daughter in Haryana's Sonepat over suspicion of her affair with a man from the same village. "The girl's father claimed...she died after falling from stairs," said Sonepat Sadar SHO Deepti Garg. "The autopsy revealed...there were injury marks on the girl's body and she died due to strangulation. We have arrested the father," she added.

100.title: BEST starts AC bus services between T1, T2 of Mumbai airport
100.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Electricity Supply and Transport (BEST) will be running AC bus services between Terminal 1 and Terminal 2 of Mumbai Airport from today. The bus service will be available 24 hours, at a frequency of 20- 30 minutes depending on the air traffic, officials said. The bus charges will be fixed at â‚¹50 for each trip, inclusive of luggage.

101.title: MNS leaders give 4-day ultimatum to remove loudspeakers from Pune mosques
101.article_body: Days after MNS chief Raj Thackeray demanded removal of loudspeakers from mosques, party leaders have given Pune Police a 4-day ultimatum to remove loudspeakers from city mosques. "We had given an ultimatum to Pune police to remove loudspeakers from mosques...If the police fail to do so, we will play Hanuman Chalisa in front of mosques," MNS leader Hemant Sambhus said.

102.title: Trains running slower than expected, punctuality declined: CAG
102.article_body: The travel time of trains has increased and punctuality declined, said a Comptroller and Auditor General (CAG) report tabled in Parliament. "The punctuality of mail/express trains over IR declined from 79% (2012-13) to 69% (2018-19)," said the report. It added that 123 out of 478 superfast trains ran at slower speeds than the specified 55 kmph.

103.title: Suspected Chinese hackers targeted India's power grid to collect data: Report
103.article_body: Suspected China-backed hackers have targeted India's power grids in the recent months under an apparent cyber-espionage campaign, Recorded Future reported. The hackers targeted at least seven "load dispatch" centres responsible for operations for grid control and electricity dispersal. The hacking group, TAG-38, used a malicious software which has previously been associated with China's PLA.

104.title: Pune woman's stalker attacks her neighbour after being rejected, held
104.article_body: A 24-year-old delivery boy in Pune who was stalking a 19-year-old woman attacked her 39-year-old neighbour with a sharp weapon after the woman asked him to leave her alone several times. Police said that the accused and the woman knew each other. The woman's grandmother had called the neighbours for help after accused threatened to harm the woman.

105.title: I thought we had the game till the 15th over: Rohit on defeat vs KKR
105.article_body: MI captain Rohit Sharma said he thought they had the game till the 15th over of KKR's innings during their match on Wednesday night. "Never expected Cummins to come and play like that...It'll be hard to digest," he added. KKR were 127/5 after 15 overs when Cummins scored 35 runs in the 16th over to chase down MI's 162-run target.

106.title: Ludhiana man suspected to be kidnapper helps 4-yr-old reunite with family
106.article_body: A man, suspected to be the kidnapper of a four-year-old based on CCTV footage, turned out to be a Good Samaritan and helped her reunite with her parents in Ludhiana. The girl went missing after losing her way while playing outside her mother's workplace. The man found her, posted her picture on Facebook and urged netizens to find her parents.

107.title: Citizens group wants Bengaluruâ€™s Cubbon Park declared 'no-honking zone'
107.article_body: A citizen group called Citizens for Citizens (C4C), in collaboration with Mount Carmel College students, launched an awareness campaign at Cubbon Park on Tuesday, urging people to avoid mindless honking. The volunteers requested police to notify the Cubbon Park area as a honking-free/silence zone. The request in this regard has been submitted to Rajender Kataria, Principal Secretary (Transport).

108.title: Mumbai man loses â‚¹1.86 lakh in sextortion, male escort fraud case
108.article_body: A 30-year-old Mumbai-based man lost â‚¹1.86 lakh in two cheating cases. He lost â‚¹60,000 in a sextortion racket in which two females, after befriending him on Facebook, got involved in obscene acts over video calls and later, threatened him of posting the videos online. The victim also lost â‚¹1.26 lakh in a fake advertisement online which provided male escort jobs.

109.title: KTR inaugurates Wipro manufacturing facility in Hyd's Maheshwaram
109.article_body: Telangana Minister for Municipal Administration and Urban Development KT Rama Rao, along with Minister for Education Sabitha Reddy and Wipro group founder Azim Premji, inaugurated a Wipro manufacturing facility in Hyderabad's Maheshwaram on Tuesday. "Wipro has invested â‚¹300 crore to set up their facility and is creating direct and indirect employment for about 900 people," KTR tweeted.

110.title: 17-yr-old girl falls off cliff while trying to take selfie in Thane
110.article_body: Police have launched a search for a 17-year-old girl who fell from a cliff in Thane on Wednesday afternoon. The girl, identified as Damini Dinkarrao, had gone to Gorakhgad with her friends on a trek. "While they were coming down...she was clicking selfies from the edge of the mountain and accidentally fell from around 60 feet height," an officer said.

111.title: MakeMyTrip launches Great Summer Travel Sale from 7th-12th April
111.article_body: Aiming to help travellers make the most of the upcoming travel season, MakeMyTrip has launched the Great Summer Travel Sale from 7-12 April with offers like up to 20% off on domestic flights, up to â‚¹15,000 off on international flights and up to 30% off on domestic and international hotels & homestays. Offers on other travel options are also available.

112.title: Not nominated for award probably because I'm boring; don't drink, smoke: Tijori
112.article_body: Filmmaker Deepak Tijori said it doesn't "hurt him" to not have won an award. "I have not even...been nominated till date...I guess probably because I've not been social animal. I don't drink, I don't smoke. I am boring, vegetarian man!" he added. He further said he played a role in 'Baadshah' as he had a good equation with the director.

113.title: Pat diye chakke: Shah Rukh Khan as Cummins slams joint-fastest IPL fifty to help KKR win
113.article_body: KKR owner Shah Rukh Khan took to Instagram to praise his team following their win against MI. "Wow again...@patcummins30 I want to dance like @ar12russell and hug you like the whole team did," he wrote. "Wow...well done KKR and what else is there to say! 'Pat' diye chakke!" he added. Pat Cummins smashed the joint-fastest IPL fifty off 14 deliveries.

114.title: Rohit says 'Awaaz badhao yaar' in frustration during post-match interview, video viral
114.article_body: A video of MI captain Rohit Sharma saying 'Awaaz badhao yaar uska thoda (Increase his volume)' during post-match interview following their defeat against KKR has gone viral. "This pretty much explains the result," a fan tweeted. "This will be hard to digest how it turned out to be in the last couple of overs," Rohit later said in the interview.

115.title: Amnesty Intâ€™l asks India to revoke travel ban on Aakar Patel
115.article_body: Amnesty International has asked the Indian government to revoke what it called an "arbitrary travel ban" imposed on author Aakar Patel. This comes after Patel, former chief of Amnesty India, was stopped from flying to US at Bengaluru airport. The global human rights body said the action against Patel shows India's "mounting crackdown on human rights defenders and activists".

116.title: MI's Daniel Sams bowls most expensive over of IPL 2022
116.article_body: Mumbai Indians (MI) fast bowler Daniel Sams bowled the most expensive over of IPL 2022 so far against Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) after conceding 35 runs in his third over of the match on Wednesday. Sams was hit for four sixes and two fours by Pat Cummins. He also bowled a no-ball, on which Cummins scored two runs.

117.title: Performed 'Khuda..' climax in boarding school, said 'Dad has done it': Abhishek
117.article_body: Actor Abhishek Bachchan said that he used to perform the climax of 'Khuda Gawah' in boarding school. "My friends, who were all foreigners...used to think I am a freak because I used to put on that climax, and perform it...I told them my dad has done it...they were very encouraging but...must have thought 'what is he doing?'," Abhishek added.

118.title: DTC bus catches fire in Delhi's Mahipalpur, shops gutted
118.article_body: A Delhi Transport Corporation (DTC) bus caught fire in the Mahipalpur area on Wednesday and a few shops near it were also gutted, officials said. No casualty was reported, officials added. The bus was running past its annual maintenance contract, officials further said. "The bus...plying on Route No. 534/39 was burnt due to smoke from its engine," DTC said.

119.title: Father sells newborn baby for â‚¹1 lakh in Delhi; held along with 5 others
119.article_body: Delhi Police have recovered a newborn baby after he was kidnapped and arrested six persons, including his father, in connection with the case. Police said, "The [baby's father]...was facing losses in...business and wanted to sell his child to earn money...He was paid around â‚¹1 lakh." Police said the accused allegedly kidnapped the infant after spiking his mother's food with sedatives.

120.title: BMTC launches digital passes for passengers to travel in B'luru buses
120.article_body: The Bengaluru Metropolitan Transport Corporation has launched mobile-based digital passes for bus passengers. People have to buy the BMTC's daily, weekly and monthly passes through the mobile application Tummoc and they've to show it on their mobile phone to the conductor. The digital pass will be generated along with a unique ID, validity and dynamic QR code, an official said.

121.title: First-ever ODI hundred was scored in the second ODI
121.article_body: ODI cricket's first-ever hundred was scored by England's Dennis Amiss in the second ODI against Australia in August 1972, a year after the first-ever ODI. Amiss, born on April 7, 1943, scored the hundred off 130 balls in what was his debut match. He also shared the first-ever ODI hundred partnership, adding 125 runs with Keith Fletcher in the match.

122.title: Present evidence doesn't suggest presence of 'XE' variant: Govt on reports of 1st case
122.article_body: After reports confirmed India's first case of 'XE' variant in Mumbai, government said present evidence doesn't suggest the presence of the new variant. "FastQ files in respect of the sample were analysed in detail by genomic experts of INSACOG who have inferred that the genomic constitution of this variant doesn't correlate with...genomic picture of 'XE' variant," government added.

123.title: Cummins smashes joint-fastest fifty in IPL as KKR hand MI their 3rd straight defeat
123.article_body: KKR's Pat Cummins smashed the joint-fastest fifty in IPL history as KKR handed MI their third straight defeat in IPL 2022. Cummins reached the 50-run mark off 14 deliveries, equalling the record of KL Rahul, who had scored a 14-ball fifty against Delhi Capitals in IPL 2018. KKR chased down the 162-run target in 16 overs.

124.title: Cummins smashes joint-fastest fifty in IPL as KKR hand MI their 3rd straight defeat
124.article_body: KKR's Pat Cummins smashed the joint-fastest fifty in IPL history as KKR handed MI their third straight defeat in IPL 2022. Cummins reached the 50-run mark off 14 deliveries, equalling the record of PBKS captain KL Rahul, who had scored a 14-ball fifty against Delhi Capitals in IPL 2018. KKR chased down the 162-run target in 16 overs.

125.title: NEET exam to be held on July 17, JEE (Main) postponed to June & July
125.article_body: The National Testing Agency (NTA) said on Wednesday that the NEET examination will be held on July 17 while JEE (Main) 2022 examinations have been rescheduled to give students across the nation more time to prepare. The JEE Session 1 examination will be held from June 20-29 while Session 2 examination will be held from July 21-30, the notification read.

126.title: Kourtney Kardashian shares pics from her Las Vegas wedding with Travis Barker
126.article_body: Kourtney Kardashian, taking to Instagram, shared pictures from her wedding with Travis Barker in Las Vegas. "After an epic night and a little tequila, a queen and her handsome king ventured out to the only open chapel with an Elvis and got married (with no license)," Kourtney captioned the post. The duo got married hours after the Grammys 2022 ceremony.

127.title: Le Tissier leaves ambassador role at Southampton after Ukraine tweet
127.article_body: Matt Le Tissier on Wednesday announced he is resigning from his role as ambassador for Southampton after receiving backlash over sharing a conspiracy theory regarding the killings of civilians in Bucha by Russian troops. Le Tissier suggested the media had "lied" about the killings, before deleting the post. Le Tissier had served as an official ambassador for Southampton since 2019.

128.title: We will not be going near there: Liverpool's Klopp on Haaland transfer
128.article_body: Liverpool boss Jurgen Klopp on Wednesday said he will not try to sign Borussia Dortmund striker Erling Haaland during the summer transfer window. "The figures being mentioned out there are crazy. We have nothing to do with them. No chance," the former Dortmund manager said. The cost to buy the 21-year-old in a multi-year deal could reportedly exceed â‚¬300 million.

129.title: India sent over 76,000 MT of fuel to Sri Lanka in last 24 hours
129.article_body: In the last 24 hours, India has sent nearly 76,000 MT of fuel to Sri Lanka, which is seeing a power crisis. "One consignment each of 36,000 MT petrol and 40,000 MT diesel was delivered...in the last 24 hours. Total supply of various types of fuel under Indian assistance...stands at more than 270,000 MT," Indian Embassy in Sri Lanka revealed.

130.title: George Russell optimistic Mercedes can 'overtake' Ferrari, Red Bull
130.article_body: George Russell is optimistic that Mercedes can "overtake" Ferrari and Red Bull to fight for the Formula One world championship this season. "It's a very long season, I think we've all got confidence that if we do things right, there's no reason why we can't close the gap and potentially overtake [Ferrari and Red Bull]," Russell said.

131.title: BJP world's largest party, earned faith of crores of people: BJP leader
131.article_body: Senior BJP leader Murli Manohar Joshi on Wednesday said, "BJP is not just country's but world's largest party. It has earned the faith of crores of people, presented them with a different ideology." He further added, "It should now focus on bringing solutions to problems arising out of present-day needs." BJP celebrated its 42nd Foundation Day on April 6.

132.title: Ancelotti tests negative for COVID-19, will travel for Chelsea match
132.article_body: Real Madrid manager Carlo Ancelotti on Wednesday tested negative for COVID-19, meaning he will travel to London ahead of Real Madrid's UEFA Champions League quarter-final first-leg match against Chelsea on Wednesday. Ancelotti tested positive for COVID-19 last week. "He will travel to London this morning to join the first-team camp," Real Madrid said in a statement.

133.title: Wish Travis, Kourtney the best that life has to offer: Ex-wife Shanna
133.article_body: Reacting to the reports of Travis Barker and Kourtney Kardashian's Las Vegas wedding, Travis' ex-wife Shanna Moakler congratulated the couple. "I wish them the best that life has to offer on their journey together," Shanna told People magazine. According to a report by TMZ, Kourtney and Travis' marriage isn't legal as they didn't get a licence for the same.

134.title: Ronald Koeman to replace Louis van Gaal as Dutch boss after World Cup
134.article_body: The Royal Dutch Football Association (KNVB) on Wednesday announced that former Barcelona manager Ronald Koeman will replace Louis van Gaal as manager after the 2022 FIFA World Cup in Qatar. Van Gaal said last week he is receiving treatment for prostate cancer. Koeman's first stint as manager of the national team ended in August 2020 so he could join Barcelona.

135.title: Have urged Putin to declare ceasefire in Ukraine: Hungarian PM Orban
135.article_body: Hungarian PM Viktor Orban said on Wednesday that he had urged Russian President Vladimir Putin to declare immediate ceasefire in Ukraine. Orban added that he offered to host talks between Russia and Ukraine, to which Putin's response was "positive" but came with conditions. Notably, Hungary has refused to supply any ammunition to Ukraine or allow its transit through its territory.

136.title: Moon Knight's character struggles with mental health issues: Curtis
136.article_body: 'Moon Knight' executive producer Grant Curtis said Moon Knight is a "very complex" character and is struggling with mental health issues. "He has...very complex life that he's trying to juggle, but in [many] ways, he's...similar to...Marvel offerings in the past," Curtis stated. "One thing...people don't...grasp is that at the heart of all Marvel movies, there's a character study," he added.

137.title: Identify all illegal immigrants from Myanmar, B'desh: J&K HC to govt
137.article_body: The Jammu and Kashmir High Court has directed the Home Secretary of the Union Territory, RK Goyal, to evolve a mechanism for the identification of illegal immigrants from Myanmar and Bangladesh. The Court's order came following a PIL, which gave directions to shift illegal immigrants from J&K, as no refugee camp has been declared in the Union Territory.

138.title: Fire breaks out at Congress' headquarters in New Delhi
138.article_body: A fire broke out at Congress party headquarters in New Delhi's Akbar Road on Wednesday around 7 pm. "There was an electric fault in ACs due to which the fire occurred. It has been doused completely," an official from the Connaught Place Fire Station said. The caretaker and guards had alerted the fire department and police about the incident.

139.title: Was shocked when R Balki approached me for 'Chup...': Dulquer Salmaan
139.article_body: Actor Dulquer Salmaan has said that he was "shocked" when filmmaker R Balki approached him for his upcoming film 'Chup: Revenge of the Artist'. "I was shocked and said, 'Are you really thinking about me for this role?' Because it's something I haven't done before," Dulquer said. The actor further said that the psychological thriller is "an experimental film".

140.title: SRK to begin shooting for Hirani's film around April 15: Report
140.article_body: Actor Shah Rukh Khan will reportedly begin shooting for his upcoming film with director Rajkumar Hirani around April 15. "Hirani has the habit of keeping a gap between two schedules...While Hirani will work on his edit of 40-day work, Shah Rukh, in the meantime, will shoot for Atlee's next," a source stated. The shooting will take place in Mumbai.

141.title: Parliament passes Bill that seeks to collect biometrics of convicts
141.article_body: Parliament passed Criminal Procedure (Identification) Bill that seeks to allow investigating agencies to collect physical and biological samples of convicts and persons accused of crimes. Union Minister Amit Shah said, "I want to assure this isn't going to violate anyone's privacy." Political detainees' biometrics won't be collected if they are detained during participation in protest, he added.

142.title: Why is he speaking on our issue?: Muskan's father on Zawahiri's video
142.article_body: After his daughter Muskan was praised by Al-Qaeda chief Ayman Al Zawahiri amid the hijab controversy, Mohammed Hussain said, "I don't even know who he is...We don't need Al-Qaeda to speak about our country's issues." In February, Muskan had defended wearing hijab and chanted 'Allah-hu-Akbar'. Her father said the video disturbed Muskan and she is worried about her education.

143.title: Haryana govt reciting tables of 35 & 80 while hiking fuel rates: Hooda
143.article_body: Former Haryana Chief Minister Bhupinder Singh Hooda on Wednesday said, "It seems as if the government is reading the table of 35 and 80 with petroleum products". He added, "Petrol and diesel in Haryana were cheaper than the neighbouring states under the erstwhile Congress government." Fuel in Haryana is now more expensive than its neighbours after multiple hikes, Hooda added.

144.title: Parliament saw healthy discussion on Ukraine, grateful to MPs: PM
144.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Wednesday said the Parliament witnessed a healthy discussion on the Ukraine situation and India's repatriation initiative 'Operation Ganga' in the last few days. He thanked MPs for enriching the discussion with their views. "The rich level of debate and constructive points illustrate how there is bipartisanship when it comes to matters of foreign policy," he tweeted.

145.title: What is the 'no-fault divorce' law that has come into force in England?
145.article_body: The 'no-fault divorce' law, which came into force on Wednesday in England, allows unhappy spouses to end their marriages without blaming each other. The onset of no-fault divorces means spouses no longer need to prove each other guilty of adultery, unreasonable behaviour or desertion. While experts expect a rush of divorces, they predict it could also increase rates of marriage.

146.title: China calls for probe into "disturbing" killings in Ukraine's Bucha
146.article_body: Chinese Foreign Ministry Spokesperson Zhao Lijian on Wednesday said that reports and images about the deaths of civilians in Ukraine's Bucha are "deeply disturbing". Lijian said the truth and specific causes of the incident should be verified, adding that blame shouldn't be apportioned before the "truth" is verified. Reportedly, China has refused to criticise Russia for its actions in Ukraine.

147.title: Maruti Suzuki to recall 19,731 EECO cars to rectify wheel size marking
147.article_body: India's largest car manufacturer Maruti Suzuki on Wednesday said it'll voluntarily recall 19,731 units of its EECO model to inspect and rectify incorrect marking of wheel size. The incorrect marking has been found in units manufactured between July 19, 2021 and October 5, 2021. "The issue has no implication on performance, safety or environment," the carmaker said in a statement.

148.title: Only use CUET for UG admissions: UGC directs Central Universities
148.article_body: The University Grants Commission on Wednesday directed the Central Universities to only use Common University Entrance Test (CUET) scores to admit students in undergraduate programmes, except for activity-oriented courses, such as performing arts. Meanwhile, the application process for the CUET 2022 for admission to undergraduate programmes began on Wednesday.

149.title: Being denied basic human needs, aim is to humiliate me: Majithia
149.article_body: SAD leader Bikram Singh Majithia has filed a plea alleging denial of "basic human needs" with the "sole view of humiliating him". He further said he was being subjected to an "insecure atmosphere" and "poor living conditions" at the Patiala Central Jail. Majithia added that he has been moved to a dilapidated cell which is used to punish inmates.

150.title: She's very straight up: Shahid on Mira being critical of his films
150.article_body: Actor Shahid Kapoor has said that his wife Mira Rajput is "very straight up" while being critical of all his films. However, he added that she doesn't "waste her time" commenting on his bad films. "She's like, 'it's so bad I don't want to comment on it. Let's talk about the ones that are decent'," Shahid further stated.

151.title: It's becoming difficult for Putin to fund Ukrainian war: White House
151.article_body: White House Press Secretary Jen Psaki on Tuesday said that it's becoming difficult for Russian President Vladimir Putin to fund the war in Ukraine. Psaki said, "What we're doing and we're already seeing effectively happen is...financial system in Russia is near the brink of collapse." Terming Putin a "war criminal", Psaki added the US is working to hold Russia accountable.

152.title: Greece, Cyprus & Israel to expand their energy cooperation
152.article_body: Greece, Cyprus and Israel will continue to expand their energy cooperation through natural gas pipelines with added focus on reducing Europe's dependency on Russian energy imports, the countries' foreign ministers said on Tuesday. The countries will build an underwater power cable that will link their electricity grids. Another project aimed to supply Europe with natural gas was also approved.

153.title: Govt to celebrate 'Yoga Mahotsav' at Red Fort in Delhi tomorrow
153.article_body: The Ministry of AYUSH will hold a 'Yoga Mahotsav' at the Red Fort in Delhi on World Health Day on April 7 (Thursday). Tomorrow is also the 75th day of the countdown to International Day of Yoga, which is observed on June 21. Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla is likely to be the chief guest at the event.

154.title: Ties with Pakistan are unbreakable: China amid Pak political crisis
154.article_body: Amid Pakistan political crisis, Chinese Foreign Ministry said that its ties with Pakistan are "unbreakable and rock solid". The ministry added Pakistan's internal turmoil won't affect the overall cooperation between the "all-weather allies". Notably, Imran Khan has been de-notified as PM of Pakistan as the President dissolved the National Assembly after it rejected a no-trust move against Khan.

155.title: US imposes sanctions on Russian President Putin's daughters
155.article_body: The US has announced new sanctions on Russian financial institutions and individuals, including Russian President Vladimir Putin's two daughters. The US also announced sanctions on the wife and daughter of Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov. The sanctions aim to increase economic pressure on Russia and Putin himself amid the massacre in Ukraine's Bucha.

156.title: Al-Qaeda will never understand but Indian Muslims will: Assam CM
156.article_body: Responding to Al-Qaeda chief Ayman Mohammed Rabie al-Zawahiri's comment on the ongoing hijab row in India, Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma said, "Al-Qaeda will never understand, but Indian Muslims will". The Al-Qaeda chief, in a video released on Tuesday, asked the Muslims to fight the assault on Islam "intellectually, using the media and with weapons on the battlefield."

157.title: West derailing our peace talks with Ukraine, fuelling hysteria: Russia
157.article_body: Kremlin said on Wednesday that peace talks between Moscow and Kyiv weren't progressing rapidly. Russia has also accused the West of fuelling "hysteria" over allegations of war crimes by Russian troops in Ukraine's Bucha in a bid to derail peace talks. Ukraine has urged more sanctions against Russia for civilian killings in Bucha, a charge Russia has termed "monstrous forgery".

158.title: India should be less worried about giving 'gyan' to world: Jaishankar
158.article_body: Minister of External Affairs S Jaishankar on Wednesday said that India should focus on its national interests and be less "concerned" about giving "gyan" to the world. The House passed the bill, which was introduced in the Lok Sabha on April 5, that seeks to "prohibit" financing of "any activity" in relation to weapons of mass destruction.

159.title: IAS officer's tweets on how to be 'smart aspirant' for interview go viral
159.article_body: IAS officer Jitin Yadav's tweets on preparing for UPSC interviews are going viral. "A smart aspirant not only prepares well for interview but also try to know background of UPSC Chairman and Members who will be heading interview boards," he wrote. He also shared information about UPSC Chairman Dr Manoj Soni and other members including, Sujata Mehta and Smita Nagaraj.

160.title: Delighted that Hrithik, Sussanne have found love again: Pooja Bedi
160.article_body: Pooja Bedi has said she's "delighted" that Hrithik Roshan and Sussanne Khan "have found love again". This comes after pictures of Hrithik and his rumoured girlfriend Saba Azad partying with Sussanne and her rumoured boyfriend Arslan Goni were shared by Pooja. Speaking to the Times of India, she said that Sussanne hosted the party to launch a cafe in Goa.

161.title: Cinema is more about stories now, not just box office numbers: Sanjana
161.article_body: Actress Sanjana Sanghi has said that Indian cinema is more about stories now and not just about box office business. "For so long...it had become all about the numbers and the box office business. In that sense, now (when stories are prioritised) is the best time to be a young leading actor in the industry," she stated.

162.title: Sidhant was in trance whole time during 'Operation...' shoot: Bhumika
162.article_body: Actress Bhumika Chawla has said that working with Sidhant Gupta in 'Operation Romeo' was a "brilliant" experience. "Sidhant was in a trance the whole time," she stated. "There's one type where you go to the disco and listen to trance and the other one is where you absorb the entire character...and live it thoroughly, I observed that," she added.

163.title: Display your names in Marathi 1st, then other languages: BMC to shop owners
163.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation of Mumbai on Wednesday ordered shop owners to display the names of their shops first in Marathi in capital letters followed by other languages. It added that the font size of Marathi letters should be bigger than others. "The names of visionary men, forts shouldn't be written on nameplates of liquor shops," the order added.

164.title: Minority killings in J&K was at peak in 2021,11 people killed: MHA
164.article_body: The killing of people belonging to minority communities in Jammu and Kashmir was at its peak in 2021, with 11 deaths, the Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) stated in the Rajya Sabha on Wednesday. "The government has taken several measures to ensure the safety of minorities in the valley," said Minister of State for Home Affairs Nityanand Rai.

165.title: Meta employees 'lovingly' call me 'The Eye of Sauron': Mark Zuckerberg
165.article_body: During an appearance on The Tim Ferriss Show, Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg said, "Some of the folks I work with at the company, they say this lovingly, but I think that they sometimes refer to my attention as the Eye of Sauron." Zuckerberg was referring to the Lord of the Rings villain usually depicted as a flaming eye.

166.title: Anil Deshmukh sent to CBI custody till April 11 in extortion case
166.article_body: Former Maharashtra Home Minister Anil Deshmukh was sent to CBI custody till April 11 in connection with an alleged extortion case. The agency took Deshmukh into its custody from Arthur Road jail earlier today and presented him before a court. Seeking his custody for 10 days, CBI claimed he's trying to evade questioning and that's why he's citing health reasons.

167.title: 2,105 migrants returned to Kashmir after repeal of Article 370: Rai
167.article_body: Minister of State for Home Affairs Nityanand Rai on Wednesday said that about 2,105 migrants have returned to the Kashmir valley after the repeal of Article 370 in Jammu and Kashmir. He said that they returned to take up jobs provided by the Prime Minister's Development Package, adding that 841 appointments were made in 2020-2021, followed by 1,264 in 2021-2022.

168.title: Great white shark kills 2 swimmers as body washes ashore in Durban
168.article_body: Two swimmers have been killed by a great white shark in a series of fatal attacks in Durban, South Africa. The first victim was discovered after his body was found washed up by a walker. South Africa's emergency medical services Netcare 911 said portions of the man's body were missing while multiple shark bites were clearly visible on the body.

169.title: Mushrooms can talk to each other and recognise up to 50 words: Research
169.article_body: Mushrooms can talk to each other and recognise up to 50 words, according to a research. The study of the electrical activity of four species of fungi found electrical impulses were structurally similar to human speech and resembled vocabulary of dozens of words. The research was conducted by professor Andrew Adamatzky from University of the West of England.

170.title: Pope Francis condemns massacre of Bucha, kisses Ukrainian flag
170.article_body: Pope Francis on Wednesday kissed a Ukrainian flag and condemned the massacre of Bucha where bodies tied and shot at close range were scattered on the streets after Russian troops withdrew from the city. "Stop this war! Let the weapons fall silent! Stop sowing death and destruction," he said at the end of his weekly audience at the Vatican.

171.title: MI, KKR announce playing XIs for their IPL 2022 clash, Baby AB makes debut
171.article_body: KKR captain Shreyas Iyer won the toss and elected to bowl first against MI. Both the teams have made two changes each to their playing XIs. Pat Cummins and Rasikh Salam replaced Tim Southee and Shivam Mavi for KKR. For MI, Suryakumar Yadav has replaced Anmolpreet Singh and 18-year-old Dewald Brevis, who's nicknamed Baby AB, is making his IPL debut.

172.title: Earth likely to be hit by geomagnetic storm today and tomorrow
172.article_body: Earth is expected to be hit by a geomagnetic storm on Wednesday and Thursday, as per a forecast by Space Weather Prediction Center of National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA). However, it'll be a minor one, NOAA said, categorising it as G1. NOAA said a coronal mass ejection from an approximately 25-degree-long filament lifted off the Sun on March 3.

173.title: US approves sale of air defence system worth $95 million to Taiwan
