173.article_body: The US Defence Security Cooperation Agency (DSCA) on Tuesday said the US has approved the potential sale to Taiwan of equipment, training and other items to support the Patriot Air Defence System in a deal worth $95 million. "The proposed sale will help to sustain the recipient's missile density and ensure readiness for air operations," the Pentagon said.

174.title: Ex-Burkina Faso Prez sentenced to life in prison over predecessor's murder
174.article_body: Ex-Burkina Faso President Blaise CompaorÃ© was sentenced to life imprisonment for complicity in 1987 murder of his predecessor Thomas Sankara, a military tribunal ruled on Wednesday. Sankara was gunned down in Ouagadougou, four years after he assumed power. CompaorÃ©, who has been in exile since 2014, was charged along with his former head of security, who received the same sentence.

175.title: AAP MLA visits school as chief guest where his mother works as sweeper in Punjab
175.article_body: AAP's Bhadaur MLA, Labh Singh Ugoke, visited a government school as chief guest where his mother has been working as a sanitation worker for last 25 years. "'Jhadu' is an important part of my life. I'll continue to do my duty at the school," she said. Ugoke, who was a mobile repair shop worker, had defeated ex-CM Charanjit Singh Channi.

176.title: BJP should live up to its Constitution: Tharoor on party's foundation day
176.article_body: Congress' Shashi Tharoor took to Twitter on Wednesday to address the BJP on its 42nd foundation day. Sharing a picture of the first page of BJP's Constitution, he tweeted, "Happy birthday BJP! You turn 42 today. Isn't it time to start living up to your own Constitution?" Tharoor added that BJP doesn't adhere to anything written on the page.

177.title: Cong helping BJP create false narrative of lawlessness in WB: TMC
177.article_body: TMC spokesperson Kunal Ghosh on Wednesday said Congress is helping BJP in creating a "false narrative" about alleged lawlessness in West Bengal and in maligning the state government. On the unnatural death of Congress councillor Tapan Kundu's murder's eyewitness, Ghosh said, "The way TMC and the state police are being blamed for it is unacceptable. We condemn it."

178.title: European Union proposes ban on Russian coal amid new sanctions
178.article_body: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen on Wednesday said the EU is set to impose further sanctions on Russia following its invasion of Ukraine including a ban on Russian coal imports. "To take a clear stand is not only crucial for us in Europe but also for the rest of the world," Von der Leyen added.

179.title: Driver dies after ramming car into Russian Embassy in Bucharest
179.article_body: Police on Wednesday said a car crashed into the gate of the Russian Embassy in Bucharest, Romania before bursting into flames and killing the driver. Police said firefighters arrived on the scene and were able to put out the fire. No immediate information has been given on a possible motive of the driver. The embassy said no employees were injured.

180.title: Netherlands prevents 14 Russian yachts from leaving over sanctions
180.article_body: The Dutch government said it is preventing 14 Russian yachts, including 12 under construction, from leaving the country due to sanctions imposed on Russia. The Ministry of Foreign Affairs said in a letter to parliament there are no "superyachts" anchored in any Dutch territories. The letter added that â‚¬516 million in assets and â‚¬155 million in transactions have been frozen.

181.title: Man arrested for killing woman by breaking coconut on her head in Thane
181.article_body: A 32-year-old man was arrested for allegedly murdering a 78-year-old woman by breaking a coconut on her head near a temple in Murbad, Thane, where she went to worship on March 23. The accused attacked her as he wanted to rob her. He later dumped the body in a nearby forest and her body was found three days later.

182.title: Peddler, 2 consumers held in Hyd, 840 gms of hash oil seized
182.article_body: Officers of the Hyderabad Narcotics Enforcement Wing, along with Nallakunta Police, seized 840 grams of hash oil and held a drug supplier, peddler and two consumers. The prime accused V Lakshmipathi was addicted to hash oil and sold it to people in Hyderabad through his drug network because his earnings weren't enough to support his expenditures, the report said.

183.title: Russian action in Ukraine's Bucha doesn't look far short of genocide: UK
183.article_body: UK PM Boris Johnson on Wednesday said the actions of Russian President Vladimir Putin's forces in the Ukrainian town of Bucha "doesn't look far short of genocide". PM Johnson pledged to impose more sanctions and more penalties on Putin's regime. Mayor of Bucha had said that over 200 people have been buried in a mass grave after Russian troops retreated.

184.title: Hyd Police busts IPL betting racket, seize material worth â‚¹56 lakh
184.article_body: A Special Operations Team of Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police Commissionerate busted an online IPL betting racket, arrested seven people and seized incriminating property worth â‚¹56 lakh. According to the report, the officers found â‚¹31,17,576 in three bank accounts belonging to the main accused and also seized cash worth â‚¹11,80,00, along with a laptop and nine mobile phones.

185.title: A girl once rejected my proposal, I said 'You have rejected Kohinoor diamond': Dhawan
185.article_body: PBKS opener Shikhar Dhawan, in a video shared by the IPL franchise, said a girl once rejected his proposal. Dhawan added, "She used to play at that time and had a dark face tone. I told her, 'You've rejected the Kohinoor diamond'." The video presenter then jokingly said, "Today, the girl would be crying, tucking her face in her pillow."

186.title: India trying to stabilise economic transactions with Russia: Govt
186.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Wednesday said India is trying to stabilise economic transactions with Russia, a day after India condemned killings of civilians in Ukraine. Jaishankar added that India has chosen the "side of peace" in the Russia-Ukraine war. Russia is India's main supplier of defence hardware but the overall annual trade between the two countries is small.

187.title: No tie-up with BJP in Maharashtra: Sharad Pawar
187.article_body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar on Wednesday said there'll be no tie-up between his party and BJP. Criticising the alleged misuse of central investigative agencies, Pawar said Maharashtra's Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) government is strong and stable and will return to power in the next Assembly elections. There'll be no change in the MVA Cabinet from NCP's side, he added.

188.title: ATS group firm goes into insolvency; may affect homebuyers of Gurugram project
188.article_body: Insolvency proceedings have been initiated against ATS group firm Anand Divine Developers after ICICI Prudential Venture filed a petition for non-payment of dues worth â‚¹25 crore. Over 443 homebuyers of the ATS Triumph project in Gurugram's Sector 104 will likely be impacted. PSP Legal's partner Piyush Singh, who is representing the project's buyers, said homebuyers must file claims immediately.

189.title: Delhi isn't Gotham City: TMC on ban on meat shops during Navratri
189.article_body: Trinamool Congress national spokesperson Saket Gokhale has written a letter to the Municipal Commissioner of South Delhi and demanded an immediate circular announcing that the ban on meat shops during Navratri is illegal. "Delhi isn't Gotham City," Gokhale said, referring to a fictional city in Batman comic books. He added that the Mayor has no executive powers to shut shops.

190.title: India to see 48,000 more EV chargers in next 3-4 years: ICRA
190.article_body: Ratings agency ICRA on Wednesday said India is likely to see around 48,000 additional electric vehicle (EV) chargers at an investment of around â‚¹14,000 crore over the next 3-4 years. It added that by FY25, electric two-wheeler penetration is expected to be around 13-15%. "India remains a laggard in EV charging infrastructure penetration," ICRA Vice President Shamsher Dewan said.

191.title: Man dies by suicide over debt concerns in Kolkata, informs wife
191.article_body: A man allegedly died by suicide after he jumped from a commercial high-rise building in Kolkata's Park Street area on Tuesday evening, police said. The man, who was reportedly working in the same building, was apparently depressed over debt concerns, a police officer said. He had messaged his wife before taking the step, the officer added.

192.title: Proof that unseen hands were behind hijab issue: Minister as Al-Qaeda praises Muskan
192.article_body: Karnataka Home Minister Araga Jnanendra said the video statement released by Al-Qaeda chief Ayman Al Zawahiri on the hijab controversy proves involvement of "unseen hands" behind the issue. Zawahiri praised BCom student Muskan for standing in defence of hijab and chanting 'Allah-hu-Akbar' in February. "All these things are being looked into by the police," the minister added.

193.title: TMC leader summoned by CBI over cattle smuggling, goes to hospital
193.article_body: TMC leader Anubrata Mondal, who was summoned by the CBI on Wednesday in connection to a cattle smuggling case, went to a state-run hospital in Kolkata. He told CBI he meant to appear before it but suddenly started suffering from shortness of breath, lightheadedness and cold sweat. He sought to dispense himself for appearing at CBI office for four weeks.

194.title: Excited to work with Charlize Theron in 'Fast & Furious 10': Jason
194.article_body: Actor Jason Momoa, speaking about working in 'Fast & Furious 10', has said, "I get to shoot with some really cool people that I have never [worked with before]." Jason further said that he is "excited" to work with actress Charlize Theron, who portrays Cipher in the film. The actor added that Charlize is "amazing".

195.title: 3 cheat credit card users in Delhi on pretext of increasing limit; held
195.article_body: Three men were arrested in Delhi for allegedly cheating people on the pretext of increasing their credit cards limit, police said on Wednesday. Two laptops, 20 mobile phones, 45 SIM cards and six diaries have been recovered from the accused, the police added. The matter came to light after a victim complained that the accused cheated them of â‚¹34,425.

196.title: Man in his 30s killed in hit-and-run by a vehicle in Delhi
196.article_body: A man in his 30s was killed after he was hit by a vehicle in Delhi's Wazirabad on Wednesday morning, police said. The vehicle driver ran away from the spot after the accident. Police did not find any document related to the man at the spot and efforts were being made to identify him.

197.title: Pune man cheated of â‚¹12 lakh by fraudster promising low-cost steel
197.article_body: Pune Police have busted a gang for allegedly defrauding people online through fake online offers of low-cost steel. Two people have been arrested and another accomplice was booked after a businessman was cheated of â‚¹12.04 lakh by one of them, who promised victim affordable steel, police said. The victim, who made the purchase online, had received a fake GST number.

198.title: Hyd Police conducts special drive to remove tinted glass from vehicles
198.article_body: The Hyderabad Police on Wednesday conducted a special drive against the tinted glass, improper number plates and stickers like MLA, Police and Press on vehicles. The police also imposed challans against the violating vehicles. Recently, the city police had reportedly fined Telugu actor Allu Arjun â‚¹700 for using tinted window shields on his luxury car.

199.title: Hand grenade thrown at worshippers in Afghanistan mosque; 6 injured
199.article_body: At least six people were left injured in a blast that was reported at a mosque in Afghanistan's capital Kabul on Wednesday, an Afghan police spokesperson said. The blast reportedly took place after someone threw a hand grenade at the worshippers during afternoon prayers at the 18th century Pul-e-Khishti mosque. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack so far.

200.title: CCI probes SBI, Axis & IDBI Bank on suspected fee cartel: Reports
200.article_body: Competition Commission of India (CCI) is investigating the trustee units of State Bank of India, Axis Bank and IDBI Bank for suspected collusion of fees, Reuters reported. Last year, Trustees Association of India (TAI) "substantially" increased the fee for assisting companies raising debt, thereby hurting competition, CCI stated in an order. TAI has challenged the probe and called it "illegal".

201.title: India's first case of new COVID-19 variant 'XE' detected in Mumbai
201.article_body: One case of the new COVID-19 variant, XE, has been detected in Mumbai. The variant, a mutation of the BA.1 and BA.2 Omicron strains, was recently traced in UK. The WHO had issued a warning against the 'XE' variant of Omicron, that may be more transmissible than any other COVID-19 strain.

202.title: Female live-in partners' plea seeking protection from family dismissed
202.article_body: The Punjab and Haryana High Court has dismissed the plea of two women in a "live-in relationship" seeking protection of "life and liberty" from their family members. The counsel stated that when the petitioners' relationship came to the knowledge of their family members, they turned against the alliance because they wanted to marry the petitioners with men of their choice.

203.title: J&K teacher beats girl for wearing tilak to school, suspended
203.article_body: A teacher in J&K's Rajouri, Nisar Ahmed, has been suspended after he allegedly hit a girl for wearing a tilak to school. "We received a complaint that a minor girl was thrashed and some objectionable words were used by a teacher against her," Rajouri Police said. Meanwhile, her father said, "If this...continues...we'll all end up breaking each other's heads."

204.title: Ukrainian journalist's 'I'm gonna quit war journalism, f**k it' tweet goes viral
204.article_body: Former Ukrainian Ambassador to Austria Olexander Scherba retweeted a tweet by Ukrainian journalist Illia Ponomarenko that read, "When this war is over, I'm gonna quit war journalism. F**k it." "I'm gonna get a quiet remote place to live and will be writing stories of whales and polar explorers," Ponomarenko wrote in the viral tweet.

205.title: Video shows the moment kabaddi player Dharminder was shot dead near Punjabi University
205.article_body: A video has surfaced online, showing the moment kabaddi player Dharminder Singh was shot dead after a clash near Punjabi University in Patiala on Tuesday night. Some people can be seen running on a street after gunshot sounds were heard. Singh was reportedly mediating between rival groups when he was killed.

206.title: Ice cream spoon swallowed by puppy removed from her stomach in Pune
206.article_body: A 12-week-old golden retriever mistakenly swallowed a plastic ice cream spoon in Pune, following which she underwent gastroscopy and the spoon was removed from her stomach. The puppy, Nora, had developed ulcers because of the spoon and had stopped eating food. The procedure, which lasted for 45 minutes, doesn't require any cuts or incisions.

207.title: S Korea to provide more jobs to Sri Lankans amid economic crisis
207.article_body: South Korea has said it will focus on providing more jobs to Sri Lankans amid the latter's economic crisis. The decision was announced after South Korean Coordination Minister Koo Yun-cheol's courtesy call to Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa. Additionally, Yun-cheol, who was on a visit to Sri Lanka, said he would encourage more Korean entrepreneurs to invest in the country.

208.title: Potential for int'l conflict between great powers is increasing: US
208.article_body: US Joint Chiefs of Staff Chairman General Mark Milley has said the potential for significant international conflict between great powers is increasing. He said, "We're...facing two global powers, China and Russia...both who intend to fundamentally change rules based on the global order." Milley, however, added US military stands ready to fight and win any country that seeks to attack it.

209.title: Sharad Pawar meets PM Modi, discusses ED's action against Raut
209.article_body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar on Wednesday met PM Narendra Modi at the latter's office in the Parliament. Reports claimed both politicians talked for nearly 20 minutes. Pawar said he discussed ED's action against Shiv Sena's Sanjay Raut with PM Modi. "If a central agency takes a step like this, then they've to take responsibility for it," he added.

210.title: Goa may be mask-free soon: CM Sawant amid a drop in COVID-19 cases
210.article_body: Amid a drop in cases of COVID-19, Goa Chief Minister Pramod Sawant said on Wednesday that Goa may be a mask-free state soon. The CM further said that the collector will issue a notification in this regard. Notably, four new COVID-19 cases were reported in Goa on Tuesday, while there were 43 active cases of the virus in the state.

211.title: J&K govt received investment proposals worth â‚¹51,000 cr: Nityanand Rai
211.article_body: Minister of State for Home Nityanand Rai said Jammu and Kashmir government has reported receiving investment proposals worth â‚¹51,000 crore so far. The figures reportedly indicated proposals received since the abrogation of Article 370 in 2019. He further informed the House about other schemes to boost industrial development in the Union Territory, including those by J&K  and central government.

212.title: 3 including govt officials booked in Thane for allegedly demanding bribe
212.article_body: A case has been registered against three people in Maharashtra's Thane district for allegedly demanding bribe. One of the accused is a retired Sub-Divisional Agricultural Officer whereas the other two are agricultural assistant and agricultural inspector, police said. They had allegedly demanded a sum of over â‚¹7 lakh from the complainant for the preparation of a detailed project report.

213.title: Don't fear being typecast, playing similar role a good challenge: Mrunal
213.article_body: Actress Mrunal Thakur who will star in the upcoming movie 'Jersey' featuring Shahid Kapoor said she does not fear being typecast. "I know as an actor what and how I can differentiate the roles I am essaying. I personally think that...playing a similar character can actually pose a good challenge for me," added Mrunal.

214.title: Recite Ram Katha, Hanuman Chalisa: MP Congress to office bearers
214.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Congress has asked its office-bearers in the state to organise events to recite Ram Katha and Hanuman Chalisa at the district level on Ram Navmi and Hanuman Jayanti. Congress' state chief Kamal Nath will also hold a special puja on Hanuman Jayanti in Chhindwara. Ram Navmi is being celebrated on April 10 and Hanuman Jayanti on April 16.

215.title: MI release their anthem song 'MI MI Bol Ke, Khelenge Dil Kholke'
215.article_body: Five-time IPL champions Mumbai Indians (MI) have launched their anthem song 'MI MI Bol Ke, Khelenge Dil Kholke'. "The music video captures the mood of the Mumbai Indians players and the GenZ, of playing the game of life with all your heart, to imagine the impossible and make it a reality...," MI said in a statement.

216.title: Made a deal with parents furious about me pursuing music: Grammy winner Ricky
216.article_body: Indian composer Ricky Kej who recently won his second Grammy said his parents were furious about his desire to become a musician. "I made a deal with them that I would finish my degree in dental surgery and they wouldn't question my life choices," added Ricky. "I finished the...degree and decided to not practise...for a single day," stated Ricky.

217.title: People said 'She is now a film actress, why will she date Rithvik': Asha
217.article_body: Talking about her breakup with Rithvik Dhanjani, actress Asha Negi said she was judged without a thought by people who created their own perspectives, which was sad. Asha made her film debut with the movie 'Ludo' which was released around the time of the breakup. "People said 'She is now a film actress, why will she date Rithvik'," added Asha.

218.title: Fabricated: Raashii Khanna on reports of her criticising South films
218.article_body: Actress Raashii Khanna has denied the reports of her "bad-mouthing" South Indian films. Taking to Twitter, Raashii called the reports doing the rounds on social media "fabricated and misconstrued content" and added, "I request whoever has been doing it to PLEASE STOP." As per the reports, the actress had said that South Indian films objectify women.

219.title: MI's Tilak Varma has shown lot of potential, composure: Shastri
219.article_body: Ex-India head coach Ravi Shastri praised MI batter Tilak Varma, stating that the 19-year-old has shown a lot of potential in his two innings for the franchise. "I'm impressed looking at his wide range of shots...there's variation in his shot selection. This player [can] go ahead," stated Shastri. "Once Suryakumar is back, MI's middle-order will be strong," he further said.

220.title: SC orders resumption of arbitration over â‚¹24,713-cr Future-Reliance deal
220.article_body: The Supreme Court has ordered Singapore International Arbitration Centre (SIAC) to resume its arbitral proceedings in â‚¹24,713-crore Future Retail's merger deal with Reliance. Both Future Group and Amazon have consented to the resumption of arbitral proceedings before the SIAC. Earlier, the Delhi High Court had stayed arbitration proceedings between the two parties in January.

221.title: Ed Sheeran wins 'Shape of You' copyright case
221.article_body: Ed Sheeran has won a UK copyright battle over the 2017 song 'Shape of You'. Sheeran and his co-writers, Snow Patrol's John McDaid and producer Steven McCutcheon, had denied allegations that the song copied part of 2015's 'Oh Why' by Sami Switch. The judge concluded that Sheeran "neither deliberately nor subconsciously" copied a phrase from 'Oh Why'.

222.title: Latest rankings for ODI batters out; 2 Indians, 2 Pakistanis in top 4
222.article_body: The ICC today released the latest rankings for ODI batters, with two Indians and two Pakistanis comprising the top four. Pakistan captain Babar Azam leads the rankings with 891 rating points. He is followed by former India captain Virat Kohli (811 rating points) and Pakistan opener Imam-ul-Haq, who jumped seven spots. India captain Rohit Sharma is ranked fourth.

223.title: In which states do India's richest real estate developers live as per Hurun?
223.article_body: According to GROHE Hurun India Real Estate Rich List 2021, Maharashtra is the preferred state for India's richest developers with 37 individuals residing there. Macrotech Developers' Mangal Prabhat Lodha & family are the richest developers in the state. Maharashtra is followed by Delhi (23), Karnataka (20), Telangana (6) and Gujarat (4). DLF's Rajiv Singh is India's richest real estate developer.

224.title: Want people to understand emotions: Divya on her breakup with Varun Sood
224.article_body: Speaking about her breakup with boyfriend Varun Sood, actress Divya Agarwal said, "I am not going to discuss my personal life...People are so used to seeing me 24/7 live...so...that's why they expect so much." "I don't want to hurt their sentiments...I want people to understand...emotions are at a deeper level," she added.

225.title: 'Kashmir Files' will do work of awakening future generation: Gadkari
225.article_body: Union Minister and BJP leader Nitin Gadkari on Tuesday said the Vivek Agnihotri directorial 'The Kashmir Files' will do the work of awakening the future generation. Gadkari said, "Agnihotri did a good job in rightly portraying...plight of Kashmiri Pandits which will do...job of awakening the coming generations." "History is important for the present to create a better future," he added.

226.title: Residents face breathing difficulty after fire at dumping ground in Chandigarh
226.article_body: Residents of Dadu Majra, Sector 38 (West), Sector 25 and Dhanas colony in Chandigarh complained of breathing difficulty, irritation in the throat and eyes and foul smell after thick smoke covered the areas following a massive fire at the Dadu Majra dumping ground. The fire that broke out at 1:30 am on Wednesday could not be doused until 12 hours.

227.title: Allu Arjun fined â‚¹700 for using tinted glass in Range Rover in Hyd: Reports
227.article_body: Telugu actor Allu Arjun was reportedly stopped at a busy market in Hyderabad and issued a challan for using tinted window shields on his Range Rover SUV. The actor, who recently starred in 'Pushpa: The Rise', paid a fine of â‚¹700 to police, as per reports. Hyderabad Police have launched a campaign of removing black tinted window shields from vehicles.

228.title: Latest rankings for ODI bowlers out, Shaheen Afridi jumps 8 spots
228.article_body: The ICC today released the latest rankings for ODI bowlers, with Pakistan fast bowler Shaheen Afridi jumping eight spots to be ranked seventh. Jasprit Bumrah, who is ranked sixth, is the only Indian in the top 10. The rankings are led by New Zealand fast bowler Trent Boult, who has accumulated 726 rating points.

229.title: Google Maps to soon show toll prices & traffic lights to Indian users
229.article_body: Google has announced that Google Maps will launch a feature showing estimated toll prices of 2,000 roads in India, US, Japan and Indonesia this month. Users will be able to avoid toll roads by selecting the "avoid tolls" option. Google Maps will also be showing traffic lights and stop signs along users' routes, along with enhanced details like building outlines.

230.title: Even remote areas of Arctic found littered with plastic waste: Research
230.article_body: High concentrations of waste plastics have been found on seafloor, rivers and remote snow-clad areas in the Arctic, scientists said. According to the researchers, large quantities of plastic waste and microplastics are being transported to the continent through oceans, rivers, shipping and air. This plastic may impact the ecosystem directly and exacerbate climate crisis in the Arctic, they added.

231.title: There will be starvation: Sri Lanka Parliament Speaker amid economic crisis
231.article_body: Amid the economic crisis in the country, Sri Lanka Parliament Speaker Mahinda Yapa Abeywardana said, "We are told this is the worst crisis, but I think this is just the beginning." "The food, gas and electricity shortages will get worse. There will be very acute food shortages and starvation," he further said.

232.title: Which countries have the most number of billionaires as per Forbes?
232.article_body: According to Forbes' World's Billionaires 2022 list, the US has the most number of billionaires at 735. This is followed by 539 in China, a drop from 626 last year. India is ranked third with 166 billionaires, followed by 134 in Germany, 83 in Russia, 67 in Hong Kong, 64 in Canada, 62 in Brazil and 52 in Italy.

233.title: My friends wanted to see my posters in Mumbai, forced me to do 'Mayuri': Sudhaa
233.article_body: Dancer and actress Sudhaa Chandran said her friends "forced" her to take up her debut movie 'Mayuri' because they wanted to see her posters all over Andheri and Mumbai. "I always thought the industry was not a safe place for the women...My father wanted me to do it [Mayuri] as it was not just entertainment but inspirational movie," she added.

234.title: Actor Allu Arjun fined for violating traffic rules in Hyderabad: Reports
234.article_body: Actor Allu Arjun reportedly landed in legal trouble for flouting traffic rules. The 'Pushpa' actor was driving his Land Rover Range Rover SUV in Hyderabad when he was stopped by cops for violation of traffic laws. The traffic police noticed Allu Arjun's SUV had tinted window shield and he had to pay a challan of â‚¹700 for breaking the rule.

235.title: RR pacer Nathan Coulter-Nile ruled out of IPL 2022 due to injury
235.article_body: RR pacer Nathan Coulter-Nile has been ruled out of IPL 2022 due to an injury he suffered during their opening game against SRH, which they won by 61 runs. Nathan had walked off the field after he bowled a no-ball and fell during his follow-through in the final over of SRH's innings. Coulter-Nile was bought by RR forÂ â‚¹2 crore.

236.title: Canadian authorities recommend 4th COVID vaccine for the elderly
236.article_body: Canada's National Advisory Committee on Immunisation (NACI) has recommended a fourth COVID-19 vaccine dose for vulnerable people including adults over 80 years of age. NACI said that the administrations could also offer the second booster to those aged between 70 and 79. It further suggested the jurisdictions to prepare for rapid deployment of second booster programmes.

237.title: Microplastics found in live human lungs for the first time
237.article_body: Scientists have discovered microplastics in live human lungs for the first time. Researchers from the University of Hull and Hull York Medical School found 39 microplastics in 11 of the 13 lung tissue samples tested. Of the microplastics detected, there were 12 types, which are commonly found in packaging, bottles, clothing, rope/twine, and many manufacturing processes.

238.title: Cong gets eviction notice over bungalow occupied by Sonia's secretary
238.article_body: The Directorate of Estates, which comes under the Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs, has sent an eviction notice to Congress regarding the bungalow situated at C-II/109 Chanakyapuri, New Delhi. The property was given to Congress but allegedly its interim chief Sonia Gandhi's secretary Vincent George has been residing there. Notably, the pending rent of the property is â‚¹3.08 crore.

239.title: ASI provides free IAS, IPS coaching in Ludhiana to underprivileged students
239.article_body: With an aim to help the underprivileged students, Assistant Sub-Inspector (ASI), Gurdev Singh, from Ludhiana has been providing free IAS and IPS coaching to the students. Singh started an institute in Ludhiana five years ago for this purpose. "The admission process starts in the month of June...Last time around 500 applications were received," Singh said.

240.title: ADB expects India's FY23 GDP to grow at 7.5%, inflation at 5.8%
240.article_body: Asian Development Bank (ADB) has pegged India's GDP growth projection for FY23 at 7.5%. ADB added that India's economic growth in the coming years will be supported by increased public investment in infrastructure and a pickup in private investment. Inflation in India is likely to increase to 5.8% in FY23 amid rising oil prices, ADB said.

241.title: Mohanlal just wants to be present and allow magic to happen: Vidya
241.article_body: Vidya Balan said Malayalam film actor Mohanlal will not do anything on set even if he has to spend a lot of time waiting. "Mohanlal told me...I...want to be present...and...when the director calls for action, I want to allow...that magic to happen," added Vidya. "To sum it up it was that the process is bigger than you," stated Vidya.

242.title: Trial in journalist Gauri Lankesh murder case to begin on May 27
242.article_body: The trial in journalist-activist Gauri Lankesh murder case is set to start on May 27, the prosecution lawyer said. "Till now hearing was going on related to bail applications. Now we are happy that the trial is beginning," Lankesh's sister said. Lankesh was shot dead by two bike-borne assailants on September 5, 2017, outside her house in Bengaluru.

243.title: Decentralised system for waste disposal needed in B'luru: BBMP chief
243.article_body: BBMP chief Gaurav Gupta on Tuesday called for decentralised system for waste disposal in Bengaluru. He said, "Almost 6,000 metric tonnes of waste is generated per day in the BBMP limits of which 1,500 tonnes is being generated by bulk generators." He added that bulk waste generators must establish a waste segregation and management unit within their area of residence.

244.title: China robotics plant made staff sleep on cardboard amid lockdown: Report
244.article_body: China-based Siasun Robotics' workers were asked to stay at its Shanghai factory through the city's lockdown to meet delivery deadlines, Business Insider said citing a report. The workers slept on cardboards at the plant. The report quoted Siasun VP saying the firm kept manufacturing to prevent "a cascading effect" of supply chain issues down the line.

245.title: Mumbai woman searches 'wine shops near me', loses â‚¹4.80 lakh while ordering
245.article_body: A 32-year-old woman from Mumbai allegedly lost â‚¹4.80 lakh while she was trying to order wine from a local wine shop. The woman searched "wine shops near me". She said she transferred â‚¹650, after which fraudster asked her to scan a QR code for returning extra money that she had sent. Money got debited when she scanned QR code.

246.title: Maha govt publishes draft rules for wine sale in supermarkets, seeks suggestions
246.article_body: The Maharashtra government has published draft rules for sale of wine in supermarkets and walk-in stores and sought public suggestions and objections on the same till June 29. This comes after the state government received strong objections from opposition parties and social activists. Stores having a minimum of 100 square metres area can only sell wine, the new policy stated.

247.title: AAP ended corruption in just 20 days in Punjab: Kejriwal in Himachal
247.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal and his Punjab counterpart Bhagwant Mann held a roadshow in Himachal Pradesh's Mandi on Wednesday ahead of state Assembly polls. Kejriwal said, "We have ended corruption in just 20 days in Punjab since Bhagwant Mann became the chief minister." He added, "Now it is time to uproot corruption from Himachal Pradesh."

248.title: Didn't take Russia's space chief's tweets seriously: NASA astronaut
248.article_body: NASA astronaut Vande Hei in response to Russian space agency chief Dmitry Rogozin's previous comments on US-Russia cooperation in space, said, "I never perceived those tweets as anything to take seriously. I just had too much confidence in our cooperation to date." Vande Hei said that he trusted his Russian colleagues, adding, "We supported each other throughout everything."

249.title: India tops world in terms of people killed in road accidents: Govt
249.article_body: Road Transport and Highways Minister Nitin Gadkari on Wednesday said India tops the world in terms of number of people killed in road accidents. Raising concern over the situation, Gadkari said in terms of number of people injured in road accidents, India holds the third position globally. Fatalities involving road users aged 18-45 stood at 69.80% in 2020, he added.

250.title: I've grown up watching them: Yash on comparisons with Salman, SRK
250.article_body: When asked about his comparison with Salman Khan and Shah Rukh Khan, KGF: Chapter 2 actor Yash said, "I'm a cinema kid. I've grown up watching their films...I'd like to add that...nothing is permanent." "They are superstars and disrespecting them or comparing isn't right. They've...been my inspiration to become an actor. They are the pillars of the industry," he added.

251.title: Mom doesn't say anything if she doesn't like my films: Abhishek on Jaya
251.article_body: When asked about his mother, actress and Samajwadi Party MP Jaya Bachchan's reaction to his film 'Dasvi', actor Abhishek Bachchan said she saw Dasvi along with some of her colleagues from the upper house and the lower house. "If [mom] doesn't like my work, she doesn't say anything. So she said a few words which...[is] a very...good sign," he added.

252.title: Self-enumeration option to be provided for Census: Govt tells Parliament
252.article_body: The option of self-enumeration will be provided in the upcoming Census which will also be Indiaâ€™s first such digital exercise, MoS for Home, Nityanand Rai, told the Parliament. Rai gave the information in response to TRS and Congress members Manne Srinivas Reddy and Komatireddy Venkat Reddyâ€™s question about whether the government will allow self-enumeration.

253.title: Puducherry to host 4-day beach festival to boost tourism
253.article_body: Puducherry will host a four-day beach festival 'I Sea Pondy 2022' from April 13 to April 16 to boost tourism in the Union Territory. The festival will have events like stage shows, water sports activities, volleyball tournament, etc. The festival will be organised across four venues â€“ Gandhi statue beach promenade, Chunnambar water sports complex, Pondy Marina and Paradise beach.

254.title: Myanmar orders foreign money held by banks to be converted to kyats
254.article_body: Myanmar's central bank has ordered that all foreign currency held by banks should be changed to local currency (kyats). In a notification issued on Sunday, locals were asked to convert their foreign currency into kyats within one working day or face legal consequences. Further, foreign currency can only be sent abroad with the government's approval, the notification read.

255.title: Criminal cases against 22 IPS officers in 5 yrs: MHA to Rajya Sabha
255.article_body: Union Minister of State in the Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) Nityanand Rai informed Rajya Sabha on Wednesday that criminal cases have been registered against 22 IPS officers under various sections from 2017 to March 30, 2022. One IPS officer has been declared fugitive in Uttar Pradesh as per information provided by the state government, Rai added.

256.title: 2 arrested with 2 kg gold bars in Assam
256.article_body: Police reportedly arrested two smugglers at the National Highway-37 (NH-37) in Assam's Morigaon district on Tuesday. Gold bars weighing two kilograms were seized from their possession, police said. "We received information about two persons coming from Sonitpur to sell gold," said Hemanta Borgohain, the officer of Jagiroad police station. They were caught during a naka checking, he added.

257.title: Iyer is making a serious case for Team India captaincy: Shoaib Akhtar
257.article_body: Ex-Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar has said KKR captain Shreyas Iyer is making a serious case for Team India captaincy with his leadership in the ongoing IPL season. "He should continue to score runs and lead the team...and I believe he'll become a big brand in the near future," added Akhtar. KKR have won two of their three games so far.

258.title: 3 girls on way to school hit by speeding car in Delhi, 1 killed
258.article_body: An 18-year-old girl student was killed and her two friends were injured after being hit by a speeding car on their way to school on Wednesday morning in Delhi's Paschim Vihar area. After hitting the girls, the car driver then rammed into a truck carrying LPG cylinders and ran away. The two injured girls are out of danger, police said.

259.title: Virat Kohli gives Glenn Maxwell massage in dressing room during RCB's chase, video viral
259.article_body: A video has gone viral on social media showing Virat Kohli giving massage to Glenn Maxwell in dressing room during RCB's successful run chase against RR in IPL 2022 on Tuesday. "Big innings on the way in next match for Maxwell," a social media user commented. RCB defeated RR by 4 wickets after chasing down 170-run target in 19.1 overs.

260.title: Anand Mahindra shares video showing 360 degree view from the top of Mt Everest
260.article_body: Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra took to social media to share a video showing 360 degree view from the top of Mt Everest. "Sometimes, when you have to make hard decisions, it helps to imagine you're on top of Everest with an unobstructed view of the world. Becomes easier to see the 'big picture'," he wrote.

261.title: I'll be a helping hand in whatever way I can: Bumrah on MI's bowling
261.article_body: Talking about MI's bowling this season, pacer Jasprit Bumrah, who has picked three wickets in their two games, said he's ready to help if the other bowlers need his help. "If somebody needs my help, I can help in any capacity...I'll be a helping hand," he stated. MI have lost both their first two matches in the season.

262.title: Big crime by Bangladesh to lose wickets against spinners overseas: Haque
262.article_body: Reacting to Bangladesh's defeat by 220 runs in the Durban Test against South Africa, Bangladesh captain Mominul Haque said it was a big crime by his team to lose wickets against spinners on foreign soil. "It is nothing but a total batting failure. We just couldn't handle the pressure," added Haque. "I think it is my fault," stated Haque.

263.title: Mumbai Police uses K3G scene to raise awareness on cyber security
263.article_body: The Mumbai Police on Wednesday shared a video clip from the movie 'Kabhi Khushi Kabhie Gham's' scene to raise awareness about cyber security. The video shared on their official Instagram handle features actresses Kajol and Farida Jalal. Sharing the video, they wrote, "Humesha cyber safety, never gham. Third party cookies can leave you vulnerable and should be declined or deleted."

264.title: 22-yr-old man stabbed to death in road rage incident in Bengaluru
264.article_body: A 22-year-old man was stabbed to death by three men in the JJ Nagar area of Bengaluru in a road rage incident on Tuesday, City Police Commissioner Kamal Pant said on Twitter. The incident reportedly took place after the victim's bike collided with another bike, leading to an argument between them. Meanwhile, police have arrested all the three accused persons.

265.title: Who are India's richest real estate developers & what are their net worths?
265.article_body: DLF's Rajiv Singh is India's richest developer with a wealth of â‚¹61,220 crore, according to GROHE Hurun India Real Estate Rich List 2021. He has overtaken Macrotech Developers' Mangal Prabhat Lodha & family, who now rank 2nd, with â‚¹52,970 crore wealth. K Raheja's Chandru Raheja & family ranked 3rd with â‚¹26,290 crore. Embassy Office Parks' Jitendra Virwani ranked 4th.

266.title: Haldiram's trends as video shows reporter questioning staff over 'Urdu' text on packets
266.article_body: Indian multinational sweets, snacks and restaurant company Haldiram's is trending on social media after a video showed a TV reporter questioning the staff of an outlet over alleged Urdu text on namkeen packets. "You can do whatever ma'am, Haldiram's won't entertain such tantrums," an employee was seen telling the reporter. Some social media users suggested the text was in Arabic.

267.title: Mumbai court sentences father to 25 yrs in jail for raping daughter
267.article_body: A special court in Mumbai sentenced a man to 25 years of rigorous imprisonment for raping his 13-year-old daughter repeatedly in their 10X10 room tenement. Noting that he deserves no leniency, the court said, "Father makes his daughter's life safe and protects her." It added, "Failure of the victim to raise shouts...doesn't in any way create doubt in her evidence."

268.title: Pic of US airport kiosk asking 'Are you a terrorist?' goes viral
268.article_body: A picture of a US airport kiosk asking "Are you a terrorist?" has gone viral on social media. Asaad Sam Hanna, a freelance journalist, shared the picture on Twitter with the caption, "Advanced level of security at the US airport." Reacting to the picture, a social media user wrote, "Wait is this really real???"

269.title: Actor Jason Momoa refutes the rumours of dating Kate Beckinsale
269.article_body: Jason Momoa has refuted the rumours of dating Kate Beckinsale. This comes after pictures of Kate wearing Jason's blazer while conversing with him at the Oscars 2022 afterparty had surfaced. Jason said, "Everyone is like, 'Are you dating?' No, no, it was chivalry. The woman was cold." In January, Jason and Lisa Bonet announced they had ended their 16-year relationship.

270.title: Cummins is world's best cricketer, no player has such intensity: Shastri
270.article_body: Ex-India head coach Ravi Shastri said Australia Test captain Pat Cummins is the best cricketer in the world, adding that he has not seen similar intensity in any other cricketer. "His 200% is guaranteed," stated Shastri. Talking about the IPL 2022 match between KKR and MI, Shastri said even Jasprit Bumrah knows that MI's bowling attack is not that penetrative.

271.title: Germany carries out nationwide crackdown on neo-Nazi groups
271.article_body: The German police reportedly carried out raids on neo-Nazi groups in 11 states across the country on Wednesday. The authorities searched the residences of as many as 50 suspected right-wing extremists. The groups - "Atomwaffen Division" (AWD), "Combat 18" (C18) and "Knockout 51" (K51) - were reportedly targeted. Four suspects were said to be arrested during the crackdown.

272.title: Hardik told me 'Until you improve, we can't give you a match': Kishan
272.article_body: MI wicketkeeper-batter Ishan Kishan said the franchise's former all-rounder Hardik Pandya told him he won't get a chance to play matches for MI until he improves. Talking about MI captain Rohit Sharma, Kishan stated if Rohit says a batter will hit the ball in a particular area, usually that is what tends to happen. MI will take on KKR today.

273.title: Terrorist incidents in J&K have reduced 45% in 4 years: Govt
273.article_body: Minister of State for Home Affairs Nityanand Rai said terrorist incidents in Jammu and Kashmir are down 45% from 417 incidents in 2018 to 229 in 2021. He said 87 civilians and 99 security personnel were killed by terrorists in J&K between August 2019 and November 2021. Robust security and intelligence grid are in place to prevent attacks, Rai added.

274.title: Mumbai man sentenced to life imprisonment for killing mother in 2015
274.article_body: A sessions court in Mumbai sentenced a 26-year-old man from Mahim, Afzal Sayyed, to life imprisonment on Tuesday for murdering his mother in 2015. The prosecution said Sayyed argued with his mother over household expenses since he couldn't contribute due to his reduced salary. After attacking her, he informed his father that she was lying in the bathroom.

275.title: Was selling soya biryani, people said it's non-veg, abused us: UP vendor
275.article_body: Mohammad Sajid, who sells biryani in Uttar Pradesh said he started selling soya biryani after being told to not sell non-vegetarian biryani till Navratri is over. "Some people came...they asked what food I was selling...I told them its soya biryani...They kept saying I was selling non-veg...my stall had been flipped. They were abusing us...We even lost around â‚¹15,000," Sajid added.

276.title: Aus building hypersonic missiles to ensure stability in Indo-Pacific: PM
276.article_body: Australia's involvement in building hypersonic missiles with AUKUS counterparts US and UK is an effort to achieve stability in Indo-Pacific region, PM Scott Morrison said on Wednesday. Better defence capabilities would help Australia, should it get involved in any future war, he added. The move reportedly comes amid concerns by AUKUS allies over China's growing military presence in Pacific.

277.title: Video shows AIMIM corporator abusing police on night duty in Hyd; FIR filed
277.article_body: A video has surfaced on social media that shows AIMIM Bholakpur corporator Mohammed Ghousuddin abusing policemen when they asked to close shops running past midnight in Hyderabad on Tuesday. The city police have registered an FIR in connection with the incident. In the purported video, the corporator is heard threatening the police team on night duty.

278.title: Worked with actors where I was uncomfortable, unsure of boundaries: Jacqueline
278.article_body: Actress Jacqueline Fernandez said that she has worked with actors in situations where she was "uncomfortable" and was not sure of "boundaries". "There are a lot of things that you have to take into account on certain scenes," she said, adding, "With John [Abraham], I've worked with him before so I understand the comfort level."

279.title: Mumbai doctor cheated of â‚¹40,000 by cyber fraudster
279.article_body: A 43-year-old Mumbai-based dermatologist was cheated of â‚¹40,000 by a cyber fraudster posing as customer care executive of ICICI bank. The fraudster told the victim that her credit card has been blocked as she didn't update her KYC. Seeing name of the fraudster's number as 'ICICI bank helpline' on Truecaller app, she shared OTP after which the amount was deducted.

280.title: One-and-half-year-old, mother fall off bike; run over by bus in UP
280.article_body: A bus ran over a one-and-half-year-old boy and his 26-year-old mother after they fell off a motorbike on the Etawah-Bareilly highway in Uttar Pradesh following which they died, police said. They were returning home on the bike of women's brother on Tuesday evening when the two-wheeler skidded, police added. The woman's brother sustained minor injuries, police further said.

281.title: Definitely want to do a full power action film, it's exciting: Bhumi
281.article_body: Actress Bhumi Pednekar has said that she "definitely" wants to do a "full power action film". "I have never done that. I want to see myself do that like some 'Matrix', some Lara Croft happening with Bhumi," she stated. Bhumi further said that she finds action films exciting and added that she is searching for such projects.

282.title: NDMC revokes order to let fasting Muslims leave office early during Ramzan
282.article_body: A day after passing an order to allow Muslim employees observing fast during Ramzan to leave their offices early at 4:30 pm, the Welfare Department of the New Delhi Municipal Council (NDMC) withdrew it. Notably, NDMC Vice-Chairman and BJP leader Satish Upadhyay had opposed the relaxation, which was supposed to be applicable from April 3 to May 2.

283.title: Bihar police officer asks for sexual favours from gang-rape victim, held
283.article_body: Bihar Police have arrested a Station House Officer [SHO] for allegedly demanding sexual favours from a 23-year-old gang-rape victim. The victim was allegedly gang-raped last year. "We talked to victim and established the veracity of her audio conversation with accused police officer. He threatened her to spoil case if she did not oblige," Gaya women's police station in-charge Ranjana said.

284.title: Extreme poverty in India less than 1% even during pandemic: IMF
284.article_body: Extreme poverty in India was recorded below 0.8% in 2019 and remained less than 1% even during the pandemic year 2020, a new report published by the International Monetary Fund (IMF) stated. Free foodgrain distribution under the Pradhan Mantri Garib Kalyan Anna Yojana (PMGKAY) was instrumental in preventing an increase in the extreme poverty levels, the report added.

285.title: Kourtney Kardashian and Travis Barker marry in Las Vegas, wedding not legal: Report
285.article_body: Kourtney Kardashian and Travis Barker got married at a chapel in Las Vegas hours after Grammys 2022 ceremony, as per a report by TMZ. However, the marriage is not legal since they didn't get a license for the same, TMZ added. They reportedly didn't allow the venue to take any photos, bringing their own photographer and security instead.

286.title: Kiraye ke tattu: Journalist to Pakistani minister as they argue during press meet
286.article_body: A video of Pakistan Minister Fawad Chaudhry arguing with journalist Matiullah Jan during a press meet is going viral on social media. After Chaudhry called Jan "a journalist on rent", he responded by saying, "Kiraye ke tattu aap honge Fawad Chaudhry." Jan could be seen heckling the minister outside Pakistani supreme court.

287.title: Website of Russian oil firm Gazprom Neft down; hack suspected
287.article_body: The website of Gazprom Neft, the oil arm of Russian gas giant Gazprom, went down on Wednesday after briefly displaying a statement by Gazprom CEO Alexey Miller. The statement cited Miller making critical comments about Russia's invasion of Ukraine. "The information published on the site...is not true and cannot be regarded as an official statement," Gazprom Neft said.

288.title: Govt's decisions will take India into situation like Sri Lanka: Mallikarjun Kharge
288.article_body: Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge on Wednesday criticised the privatisation of public sector units and said that the decisions of the Indian government might take the country into a "Sri Lanka-like situation". "The inflation is continuously increasing across the country and the government is selling the public sector enterprises," Kharge added.

289.title: Russian astronauts were blindsided by yellow suits issue: NASA's Vande Hei
289.article_body: NASA astronaut Mark Vande Hei has said the Russian cosmonauts who arrived at the space station last month wearing colours of the Ukrainian flag were paying tribute to their university which has blue and yellow in its emblem. He added the astronauts were "blindsided" by the controversy over their spacesuits' colour. Vande Hei spent 355 consecutive days in Earth orbit.

290.title: Railways to make more overbridges to deal with waterlogging: Minister
290.article_body: Railways Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw said Indian Railways is making efforts to make more overbridges rather than road under bridges (RUBs). This will help in dealing with problems such as waterlogging in underground projects, he added. He further informed the Lok Sabha that Research Design and Standards Organisation (RDSO) has studied the issue in detail and offered remedial measures.

291.title: Ukrainian man avoids 'mined roads' to install SpaceX service in village
291.article_body: Ukrainian Vice PM Mykhailo Fedorov took to Twitter to share an image of a man, installing a SpaceX Starlink station in Liubech, who "bypassed many mined roads to reach the village". "The village was occupied by [Russia] and cut from [Ukraine]...and now its citizens have access to the world," Fedorov said. Ukraine had asked SpaceX's help post Russia's invasion.

292.title: 30-year-old man arrested for vandalism in Puri's Jagannath temple
292.article_body: A 30-year-old man was arrested for allegedly vandalising the kitchen of Puri's Jagannath temple on Wednesday. The accused, identified as J Mohapatra, had allegedly vandalised the 'chulhas' (earthen stoves) at the temple as he was "feeling uneasy about something", police said. At least 43 earthen stoves, which are used to prepare the temple's 'mahaprasad', were found vandalised on Sunday.

293.title: Suryakumar might be a bit rusty: Aakash on MI's game against KKR
293.article_body: Talking about MI batter Suryakumar Yadav, who's likely to play in their match against KKR, cricketer-turned-commentator Aakash Chopra said the 31-year-old might be a bit rusty. "Because he hasn't played [in] a while...He will need to find some rhythm," added Aakash. Suryakumar missed MI's first two games and hasn't played any competitive cricket since February due to a finger injury.

294.title: Food ordering apps Zomato and Swiggy down
294.article_body: Food delivery apps Zomato and Swiggy on Wednesday reported a nationwide outage due to technical issues. Users took to Twitter and wrote, "Zomato and Swiggy are down! Food crisis has started!" and "Dude why are Swiggy and Zomato down at the same time?? Bhook lagi hai yaar." "How on earth both gone down at the same time?" another user tweeted.

295.title: Rihanna makes her debut on Forbes annual billionaires list
295.article_body: Pop star Rihanna is among the new entries in Forbes' Annual World's Billionaires List this year. The 34-year-old singer, who is expecting her first child, is worth $1.7 billion, according to Forbes. Her stakes in the Fenty Beauty cosmetics line and the Savage X Fenty lingerie business helped make her Barbados' first billionaire, Forbes said.

296.title: AMU professor gets show cause notice over 'mythical references' to rape slide
296.article_body: The Aligarh Muslim University (AMU) issued a show cause notice to professor Dr Jitendra Kumar for hurting religious sentiments of students, staff and citizens through a presentation to a class that included a slide on "mythical references" to rape. The professor has been asked to submit his reply within 24 hours. He has also submitted an unconditional apology.

297.title: 2 terrorists killed in Tral encounter in Kashmir: Police
297.article_body: Two terrorists were killed in an encounter in Jammu and Kashmir's Tral area on Wednesday, police said. They belonged to the proscribed terror outfits Ansar Ghazwat-ul-Hind and Lashkar-e-Taiba, police added. "Before shifting to Tral...both were involved in several terror crimes in Srinagar city including recent killing of sarpanch in Khanmoh," said Vijay Kumar, Inspector General of Police, Kashmir.

298.title: Pune's Katraj zoo gets sprinklers, coolers for animals amid heat
298.article_body: Amid soaring temperatures, authorities at Pune's Rajiv Gandhi Zoological Park and Wildlife Research Centre in Katraj have installed sprinklers, coolers and foggers for the animals. "There are water pools for elephants [and] ponds for other big animals," said Rajkumar Jadhav, Director of the zoo. The zoo reportedly houses at least 440 animals of 63 different species, including eight tigers.

299.title: 6 lakh people took ride on Pune Metro in 1st month after inauguration
299.article_body:
Around six lakh people took a ride on the Pune Metro in the first month after its inauguration in March. The two metro stretches, Vanaz to Garware College and Pimpri-Chinchwad to Phugewadi, generated a total fare revenue of â‚¹84 lakh in the one-month period, officials said. 
The metro saw the maximum number of passengers (67,350) on March 13.

300.title: If India has chosen a side, it has chosen the side of peace: Govt on Russia-Ukraine war
300.article_body: Speaking on the Russia-Ukraine war in the Parliament on Wednesday, Union External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar said, "If India has chosen a side, it has chosen the side of peace." He added, "Attributing political colour to India's actions vis-a-vis Ukraine situation is unfortunate." The minister also called for an independent investigation into the killings in Bucha in Ukraine.

301.title: Comparing B'luru with Hyd is an utter joke: K'taka CM on KTR's remarks
301.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Tuesday said that Telangana IT Minister KT Rama Rao's attempt to compare Bengaluru with Hyderabad is an "utter joke". CM Bommai said, "[People] from across the world are coming to Bengaluru. The highest startups...highest unicorns are in Bengaluru." This comes after Rao tweeted asking a Bengaluru-based entrepreneur to shift to Hyderabad for better facilities.

302.title: It's just an employee going slightly bonkers: CEO Suhail on BharatPe-Ashneer row
302.article_body: Speaking about the BharatPe-Ashneer Grover row, CEO Suhail Sameer told Moneycontrol, "Whatever happened was basically an employee going slightly bonkers, which...happens in a lot of companies." On the outcome of audits by Alvarez & Marsal and PwC, Suhail said, "It is not as controversial as everyone thought." Ashneer and his wife Madhuri were accused of misappropriation of funds.

303.title: Man masturbates in front of woman on US flight; says 'I asked her before doing it'
303.article_body: A man on a Southwest Airlines flight from Seattle to Phoenix is facing federal charges for masturbating four times in front of a female passenger. Antonio Sherrodd McGarity, who was arrested when the flight landed, said that he asked the "female witness if she minded if he masturbates". He added that the woman said, "It really doesn't matter."

304.title: Couple jumps into a canal following an argument in UP, dies
304.article_body: A couple reportedly died by suicide after jumping into a canal in Uttar Pradesh's Firozabad, police said on Wednesday. As per police, the husband jumped into the canal first, followed by his wife after they got into an argument on their way back from his in-laws' house. Police later recovered their bodies with the help of locals.

305.title: Starbucks announces plans to get into NFT business
305.article_body: Starbucks CEO Howard Schultz has announced the firms' plans to get into the non-fungible-token (NFT) business. It's working on "digital innovation through NFTs" and expects to unveil details soon. "If you look at the companies, the brands...that are trying to create a...NFT...business, I can't find one of them that has the treasure trove of assets that Starbucks has," Schultz said.

306.title: 3 arrested in Gurugram for assaulting private firm's planning manager
306.article_body: The Gurugram Police arrested three men for allegedly assaulting a planning manager of Godrej Properties after intercepting his car in Gurugram's Sector-7. One of the accused's brother and friend had obtained tenders for supplying water and soil at a construction site of the firm but later the work was allotted to some other contractor, the police said.

307.title: Nadda participates in 'Shobha Yatra' in Delhi on BJP's 42nd foundation day
307.article_body: BJP National President JP Nadda participated in BJPâ€™s 'Shobha Yatra' on the occasion of the partyâ€™s 42nd foundation day, in Delhi's Karol Bagh on Wednesday. Nadda hoisted the party flag at the party headquarters in the national capital on the occasion. He also garlanded the statues of Dr Syama Prasad Mookerjee and Pandit Deendayal Upadhyaya.

308.title: Balasaheb, your Hindu son banning singing of Hanuman Chalisa: MNS Poster
308.article_body: Amid loudspeaker controversy, a poster has been put up by the Raj Thackeray-led Maharashtra Navnirman Sena outside the Shiv Sena Bhawan in Mumbai. "Balasaheb, look, your son...Uddhav...being a Hindu is banning singing of Hanuman Chalisa. Loudspeakers installed by Hindus are being removed. Your Thackeray style and heritage in true sense are only being followed by Rajsaheb Thackeray," poster read.

309.title: 7 of family fall ill after consuming adulterated food in UP, probe launched
309.article_body: Seven members of a family were hospitalised after allegedly consuming adulterated food in UP's Muzaffarnagar district. The family members had consumed food made of adulterated buckwheat (Kuttu) flour on Tuesday following their Navratri fast. However, they complained of stomach ache and started vomiting shortly after consuming the food, police said, adding a probe has been launched into the matter.

310.title: Uddhav has joined queue of pseudo seculars: Fadnavis on row over loudspeakers
310.article_body: BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis criticised Shiv Sena chief Uddhav Thackeray, saying that he has joined the queue of "pseudo seculars". "He doesn't take action on loudspeakers (at mosques) even after HC order but when 'Hanuman Chalisa' is played on loudspeakers, it's seized," Fadnavis added. Reacting to Sena's corruption claim against Kirit Somaiya, he said, "They have not provided any evidence."

311.title: 1st phase of expansion at Hyderabad airport completed: GHIAL
311.article_body: The first phase of expansion at Hyderabad airport has been completed, GMR Hyderabad International Airport Limited (GHIAL) officials said. The airport's expanded terminal is all set to open in the coming weeks, officials added. The airport has now added a first of its kind 264-meter long tunnel for movement of Ground Staff Equipment (GSE) to 42 aircraft stands, officials stated.

312.title: Srinagar to Delhi travel will take just 8 hours in future: Gadkari
312.article_body: Union Minister of Road Transport and Highways Nitin Gadkari has said that the work on Srinagar-Katra-Delhi expressway is in progress and that "in future people will be able to reach Delhi from Srinagar in just eight hours". His statement came at an event held in Delhi to felicitate the actors and director of 'The Kashmir Files' film.

313.title: Man City, Liverpool secure first leg wins in Champions League quarterfinals
313.article_body: Premier League sides Manchester City and Liverpool have registered wins in their respective first legs of the Champions League quarterfinals. Kevin De Bruyne scored the lone goal as City defeated Atletico Madrid while Liverpool's Luis Diaz, Ibrahima Konate and Sadio Mane scored a goal each in their 3-1 win over Benfica. The second legs will be played on April 12-13.

314.title: Shruti shares childhood pic, says 'The child in us always has more wisdom'
314.article_body: Shruti Haasan took to her Instagram handle and shared a childhood picture of her in school uniform. Sharing the post, she wrote, "Our most defining moments the ones that shape us forever happen in childhood...Sometimes those memories we can't let go off...The child in us always has more heart and wisdom than we pretend to have as grown-ups."

315.title: Sridevi had passed away, I did it out of love for her: Vidya on 'Nerkonda...'
315.article_body: Actress Vidya Balan said that she took up the Tamil film 'Nerkonda Paarvai' for the love she has for late actress Sridevi and filmmaker Boney Kapoor. "I didn't even give it any thought...Sridevi had just passed away...I met Boney ji...who said, 'I want you to do a special appearance in my film'...I said, 'I don't want to...know anything'," Vidya added.

316.title: 51,061 positions for health workers lying vacant across country: Centre
316.article_body: As many as 51,061 posts are currently vacant for workers in various primary health care sectors across India, Union Minister of State for Health, Bharati Pawar, told the Rajya Sabha. Pawar said there were 38,465 primary health centres, community health centres, sub-district/divisional hospitals and district hospitals, including central government hospitals across the country as of March 31, 2020.

317.title: Tired of working; helping poor, needy without any recognition: Faisal
317.article_body: Congress leader Ahmed Patel's son, Faisal Patel took to Twitter to say that he is "Tired of working and helping the poor and needy without any recognition". "Keeping my options open could mean I am thinking of quitting public life forever," he wrote on Twitter, while also tagging the official Twitter handle of the Indian National Congress.

318.title: Thief gets stuck in Andhra temple's window while escaping with ornaments, video viral
318.article_body: A video has gone viral on social media showing a thief being stuck in the window of a temple in Andhra Pradesh's Srikakulam district. The thief got stuck while trying to escape with silver ornaments he had stolen from the temple. The police opened the temple and moved him out of the window before taking him into their custody.

319.title: Take money back if it doesn't make you cry: Ranveer on 'Jayeshbhai...'
319.article_body: Talking about his upcoming film 'Jayeshbhai Jordaar', Ranveer Singh said people who don't cry after watching the movie are welcome to take their money back. The film's producer Maneesh Sharma earlier stated that Ranveer has delivered a performance of a lifetime. "His performance makes me marvel yet again at what artistic heights this fine actor is capable of," added Maneesh.

320.title: Delhi HC directs MCDs to file report on spa centres running with valid license
320.article_body: The Delhi HC on Tuesday directed the three municipal corporations of Delhi to file a report regarding the number of spa centres in their jurisdictions. The court also asked how many of them are running legally with a valid license or otherwise. The bench has listed the matter on August 30, 2022, for further hearing.

321.title: Paytm CEO's stock options to vest only when its market cap crosses IPO level
321.article_body: In a letter to shareholders, Paytm CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma said, "My stock grants will be vested to me only when our market cap has crossed...IPO level on a sustained basis." The stock is down "significantly" due to "volatile market conditions", he added. Paytm parent One97 Communications' shares had fallen over 70% below its IPO price since its November listing.

322.title: BEST to introduce multi-purpose mobile vans in Mumbai to pay utility bills
322.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Electricity Supply and Transport (BEST) Undertaking will introduce multi-purpose mobile vans which would move around Mumbai to enable people to pay all their utility bills starting from April 7. "We are starting with one van this week and in total there will be five vans that shall be put in service," BEST Undertaking's General Manager Lokesh Chandra said.

323.title: India stands firm on its interests when the world is divided into 2 factions: PM Modi
323.article_body: PM Narendra Modi while addressing the 42nd foundation day of BJP on Wednesday said, "Today, there is an India in front of the world which stands firm for its interests, without any fear or pressure." He added, "When the entire world is divided into two rival factions, India is being viewed as a nation that can firmly speak about humanity."

324.title: Experiencing fame at an early age can lead to trauma: Cole Sprouse
324.article_body: Actor Cole Sprouse, who rose to popularity with his twin brother Dylan on the Disney programme, 'The Suite Life of Zack and Cody', said experiencing fame at an early age can lead to trauma. Comparing his experience to that of young ladies on the channel, Sprouse said the young women on the channel were "heavily sexualized" from a young age.

325.title: Samson must be questioned for giving easy pickings to Karthik: Gavaskar
325.article_body: Ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar said RR captain Sanju Samson must be questioned for giving easy pickings to Dinesh Karthik, by keeping no fielders in the deep on the on-side in the 19th over of RCB's innings. Prasidh Krishna conceded 12 runs in the over with 15 runs to defend, as Karthik scored consecutive boundaries. RCB beat RR by four wickets.

326.title: Gupshup acquires AI platform Active.Ai in its 2nd acquisition this yr
326.article_body: Conversational messaging unicorn Gupshup has acquired Active.Ai, a conversational AI platform used by banks and fintech firms. Gupshup had acquired Knowlarity Communications, a cloud communications startup, earlier this year. Active.Ai offers a Conversational Banking as a Service (CBaaS) platform across 43 countries. Its customers include Axis Bank, Kotak Mahindra Bank and Tata Capital.

327.title: Karthik was frantic at KKR, there was a lot on his mind: Brathwaite
327.article_body: Ex-KKR all-rounder Carlos Brathwaite said former KKR captain Dinesh Karthik seemed frantic while representing the franchise and it almost seemed like he was hunting for a score. "There was a lot on his mind," added Brathwaite. Karthik scored an unbeaten 44 off 23 balls at a strike rate of 191.30 in RCB's IPL 2022 win against RR.

328.title: Was waiting to tell the world about it: Rashmika on working with Ranbir in Animal
328.article_body: Speaking about sharing screen space with actor Ranbir Kapoor in her upcoming film 'Animal', actress Rashmika Mandanna said, "I'm...thrilled, that the announcement is finally out." "I had been waiting to tell the world about it, because not only is the story...amazing but also the team I get to work with, it's like a dream come true," she added.

329.title: Entering girl's house this way unsafe: Karan on photographers chasing Tejasswi
329.article_body: Actor Karan Kundrra, while speaking about photographers chasing actress and his girlfriend Tejasswi Prakash, said that entering someone's house, especially girl's, is not safe. "Uncle and aunty [Tejasswi's parents] got flustered...because they didn't know what was going on...I felt like this is something I need to address...I spoke to them (photographers)...they understood my concern," Karan said.

330.title: CBI arrests ex-Maharashtra Home Minister Anil Deshmukh in corruption case
330.article_body: Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) has arrested former Maharashtra Home Minister Anil Deshmukh in the corruption case registered against him. This comes after CBI took custody of Deshmukh's personal secretary Sanjeev Palande, personal assistant Kundan Shinde and dismissed assistant police inspector Sachin Vaze. A PMLA court on Friday allowed CBI to take custody of Deshmukh, Palande and Shinde.

331.title: 18.5% swabs from maternity, labour rooms show bacterial contamination: Study
331.article_body: A Gujarat-based study found maternity units and labour rooms of public health care facilities may not be free of bacterial contamination. After 195 swab samples were reportedly taken from various surfaces such as beds, mops, sink-taps, it was found that 18.5 per cent show bacterial contamination with highest contamination seen in labour rooms, followed by maternity units and general wards.

332.title: Fire breaks out at a house in Delhi's Badli extension, 8 rescued
332.article_body: Eight people were rescued after a fire broke out at a house in Badli Extension near Delhi's Rohini around 6 am on Wednesday. "Upon receiving the information, a total of three fire tenders were rushed to the location," said Atul Garg, Director, Delhi Fire Service. While the reason behind the fire is yet to be ascertained, cooling operations are underway.

333.title: 4 of family, including 5-yr-old child, killed in road accident in Odisha
333.article_body: A man, his two daughters and his five-year-old grandson were killed after their motorcycle was hit by a speeding van in Odisha's Ganjam district on Tuesday. According to police, the accident occurred in Indhanapur when they were returning from Munigadi. Following the accident, villagers reportedly blocked a section of the Aska-Bhanjanagar road demanding compensation for the deceased's family.

334.title: Ex-Amnesty India chief Aakar Patel stopped from leaving India
334.article_body: Former Amnesty India chief Aakar Patel on Wednesday said he was stopped from leaving India at the Bengaluru airport. Tagging PMO, Patel asked why he was put on the "exit control list". He later tweeted, "CBI officer called to say I am on the look-out circular because of the case [PM] Modi government has filed against Amnesty International India."

335.title: Trailer looks meaner, leaner & stronger: SRK on actor Vijay's film 'Beast'
335.article_body: Actor Shah Rukh Khan on Tuesday took to his official Twitter handle to share a good luck message to Thalapathy Vijay for his upcoming film 'Beast'. Sharing the post, he wrote, "Sitting with @Atlee_dir who is as big a fan of @actorvijay as I am. Wishing the best for 'Beast' to the whole team...trailer looks meaner...leaner...stronger."

336.title: PM Modi-led govt gave new definition of governance in last 8 yrs: Hardeep Puri
336.article_body: PM Narendra Modi-led government has given a new definition of governance in the last eight years, Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri said on the occasion of BJPâ€™s 42nd foundation day on Wednesday. "I would like to give you an example of UP. We received success there because development was done there rapidly and with all sincerity," he stated.

337.title: Woman damages 2 luxury cars of ex-boss after being sacked in Chennai, held
337.article_body: A 30-year-old woman was arrested for allegedly damaging two luxury cars of her former employer, a Pattali Makkal Katchi (PMK) worker, in Tamil Nadu's Chennai after she was sacked, police said. She hurled stones at cars following which their windshields got damaged, police added. The woman used to work in a chain of salons owned by the employer, police stated.

338.title: Dad sold his house after film with Dharmendra got delayed; was huge loss: Rupali
338.article_body: Actress Rupali Ganguly revealed her father, filmmaker Anil Ganguly, had to sell his house after a film that he was doing with actor Dharmendra got delayed. "People used to sell their houses to make movies...like how it happened with us," she said. "This Dharmendra film...got delayed for four years, [it] resulted in a massive loss for the family," she added.

339.title: Shreyas needs to be mindful of the game, take some time on field: Shastri
339.article_body: Ex-India head coach Ravi Shastri has said KKR captain Shreyas Iyer needs to spend some time on the field before playing his shots. "As a captain, he should be a bit mindful...of the game...The way he got out in the last two matches, he could've easily taken four-five balls and tried that shot. There was no...hurry," explained Shastri.

340.title: Constitution allows me to eat meat when I like: TMC's Mahua Moitra
340.article_body: TMC MP Mahua Moitra said she lives in South Delhi and the Constitution allows her to eat meat when she likes and the shopkeeper the freedom to run his trade. Her statement came after the South Delhi Municipal Corporation Mayor, Mukkesh Suryaan, issued an order asking officers concerned to take action for the closure of meat shops during Navratri.

341.title: Number of commuters increases in Mumbai's AC local as mercury soars
341.article_body: With the rise in temperature in Mumbai, the number of daily passengers using AC locals has jumped, the officials said. In first four days of April, we have already seen around 1.07 lakh commuters using AC locals, the officials added. In March, there were 4.76 lakh passengers, whereas in February, 3.14 lakh passengers travelled using AC locals, they further informed.

342.title: When your ex comes back to haunt you: RR on Chahal bowling against RCB
342.article_body: Referring to Yuzvendra Chahal bowling against his former team RCB in their IPL 2022 clash on Tuesday, RR tweeted, "When your ex comes back to haunt you." Chahal went on to register bowling figures of 4-0-15-2 in the match. He took wickets of David Willey and Faf Du Plessi, and was also involved in Virat Kohli's run-out.

343.title: Paytm says it will break even operationally in 1.5 years, shares jump
343.article_body: Shares of Paytm parent One97 Communications jumped over 6% during intraday trade on Wednesday after the company said it expects to break even on an operational basis over the next year-and-a-half. "We are going to achieve this without compromising any of our growth plans," CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma said. The company's shares have fallen around 70% below its IPO price.

344.title: Class 10 student cheats through WhatsApp by hiding phone in glass clipboard in Haryana
344.article_body: A Class 10 student was caught by the flying squad of Board of School Education Haryana (BSEH) for cheating during his English board exam in Fatehabad district. The student was using a glass clipboard with a mobile phone stuck to its middle. He had opened several apps, including WhatsApp, to cheat. He was hiding the phone with a paper.

345.title: At 24, I went to US with my broken English, home food to chase my dream: Agarwal
345.article_body: Vedanta's billionaire Chairman Anil Agarwal said he left for the US when he was 24 to expand his cable business and buy second-hand equipment. "With my tooti-footi (broken) English, a suitcase filled with ghar ka khana and a...friend from Bihar...I took off to chase my dream," he recalled. He stitched $500 to his coat's inside due to fear of pickpockets.

346.title: Kabaddi player shot dead at Punjabi University in Patiala
346.article_body: A kabaddi player, Dharminder Singh, was shot dead after a clash in front of Punjabi University in Patiala on Tuesday night. Singh was reportedly mediating between rival groups when he was killed. The incident comes after international kabaddi player Sandeep Singh Nangal Ambian was shot dead by four assailants in Jalandhar on March 14.

347.title: Dhanashree Verma's reaction to Yuzvendra Chahal taking wicket against RCB goes viral
