347.article_body: YouTuber-choreographer Dhanashree Verma's reaction to her husband, RR leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal, taking the wicket of RCB's David Willey has gone viral on social media. Dhanashree was seen aggressively pumping her fists in the air. Chahal registered bowling figures of 4-0-15-2 against RCB. Notably, Chahal had represented RCB from 2014 to 2021.

348.title: Ruchi Soya shares fall 19% after â‚¹4,300-cr FPO allotment announcement
348.article_body: Ruchi Soya shares fell over 19% during the early trading hours on Wednesday as its board cleared the allotment of 6.61 crore equity shares via a follow-on public offer (FPO) to raise â‚¹4,300 crore. The company fixed the issue price at â‚¹650 per share. The firm had received SEBI's approval to raise funds through an FPO in August last year.

349.title: Karthik needs to put his name back in international cricket: Plessis
349.article_body: RCB captain Faf du Plessis has said wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik is playing his best cricket and needs to put his name back in international cricket. Karthik has remained unbeaten in IPL 2022 and has scored a total of 90 runs, including 11 fours and 5 sixes. "His calmness towards the end allows others to just come in," stated Plessis.

350.title: PM Modi criticises dynasty politics on BJPâ€™s 42nd foundation day
350.article_body: Addressing party workers on BJP's 42nd foundation day, PM Narendra Modi criticised dynasty politics saying it harmed the country a lot in past decades. "Two kinds of politics are going on - one of love for family, other of love for nation," said Modi. "These [dynastic] parties didn't let the youth progress and always betrayed them," he added.

351.title: BJP's Kirit Somaiya siphoned off â‚¹58 cr raised to save INS Vikrant: Raut
351.article_body: Shiv Sena's Sanjay Raut accused BJP leader Kirit Somaiya of allegedly siphoning off â‚¹58 crore that was crowd-funded to save INS Vikrant. "Somaiya had offered to help out with the fund-raisers and said the amount collected would be handed over to Maharashtra Governor. The Raj Bhavan (in an RTI reply) has stated that no such money was received," Raut said.

352.title: 100% adult population in Mumbai fully vaccinated against COVID-19: BMC
352.article_body: All eligible beneficiaries above 18 years of age in Mumbai have been fully vaccinated against COVID-19, the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) informed on Tuesday. The entire adult population comprising 92.39 lakh people have been given both doses of the vaccine, BMC said. With this, Mumbai has become the first major city in India to fully vaccinate 100% of its adults.

353.title: BJP giving competition to vote bank politics: PM on party's foundation day
353.article_body: BJP is giving competition to vote bank politics, PM Narendra Modi said on the occasion of the party's 42nd foundation day. "BJP has not only given competition to this vote bank politics but has also been successful in explaining its disadvantages to the countrymen," he added. "The youth...have now started to understand...'parivarwaadis' are the biggest enemy of democracy," PM stated.

354.title: Soni reunites with Helen after 20 years, says 'Making some wonderful memories'
354.article_body: Actor Soni Razdan has shared pictures as she reunited with veteran actor Helen for an upcoming project. Taking to Instagram, Soni shared pictures of her meeting Helen at a restaurant. She captioned the post, "We actually met up again after more than 20 years. We share some wonderful special memories! And we're on the verge of making some more."

355.title: Hardik is not chubby and bubbly any more: Ex-chief selector MSK Prasad
355.article_body: Ex-chief selector MSK Prasad said Team India all-rounder Hardik Pandya is not chubby and bubbly any more, adding that getting married as well as being GT's captain will help him. "Whenever Hardik does well, I feel proud and I feel like my own son has performed. The beauty about this boy is that his basics are very strong," stated Prasad.

356.title: BJP fulfilling aspirations of poor: Amit Shah on party's 42nd Foundation Day
356.article_body: BJP leader Amit Shah on Wednesday extended greetings to party workers on BJP's 42nd Foundation Day. "Under leadership of Narendra Modiji...BJP has become a means of fulfilling the aspirations of crores of poor, farmers, downtrodden and women of the country deprived for seven decades," he tweeted. He further said that BJP's journey has been about national service, upliftment and reconstruction.

357.title: Suppose it's ok to ban non-Muslims from eating in public during Ramzan: Omar
357.article_body: National Conference leader Omar Abdullah has expressed his views amid the ongoing meat-ban debate. "During Ramzan we don't eat between sunrise & sunset...I suppose it's OK if we ban every non-Muslim resident or tourist from eating in public, especially in the Muslim dominated areas. If majoritarianism is right for South Delhi, it has to be right for J&K," he wrote.

358.title: 3 cash-loading employees steal â‚¹77 lakh, set ATM on fire in Mumbai; held
358.article_body: Three employees of a cash-loading and management company have been arrested for allegedly misappropriating â‚¹77 lakh from an ATM in Mumbai's Goregaon and setting it on fire. "We suspect the trio may have conspired with a few co-workers...and are interrogating them further for leads," a police official said. "The misappropriated sum is yet to be recovered," the official added.

359.title: Ishaan to train for Dhyan Chand's biopic, undergo intense preparation: Report
359.article_body: Actor Ishaan Khatter will reportedly start shooting for late hockey player Major Dhyan Chand's biopic in November or December. "Ishaan will also start training for the part a couple of months before they start shooting for the film. It will be an intense prep. Meanwhile, work on the final script is on," Pinkvilla quoted a source as saying.

360.title: Will take at least 10 yrs to clear Ghazipur landfill: Delhi civic body
360.article_body: East Delhi Municipal Corporation (EDMC) has told Delhi Assembly's Environment Committee that it will take at least 10 years at peak performance to clear the Ghazipur landfill, panel's chairperson Atishi said. "EDMC commissioner pointed out that the amount of garbage being treated every day at the landfill is almost equal to the fresh garbage being added there," she added.

361.title: Will Smith-led VC firm invests in blockchain network Boba
361.article_body: Ethereum blockchain scaling platform Boba Network has raised $45 million in its series A round, from Will Smith-led Dreamers VC, Paris Hilton and her husband Carter Reum's M13 and cryptocurrency exchange Crypto.com, among others. The funding has pushed Boba's valuation to $1.5 billion. Boba Network's crypto token's market capitalisation rose over 19% to $272.1 million after the announcement.

362.title: Man held for posing as Army officer, cheating job aspirants in Maharashtra
362.article_body: The crime branch unit of Satara Police in Maharashtra arrested a man who posed as an Army officer and cheated many job aspirants for lakhs of rupees on the pretext of helping them in recruitment, said officials. He had been taking â‚¹9 lakh from each aspirant candidate, â‚¹4.5 lakh before and â‚¹4.5 lakh after the recruitment, police said.

363.title: Not in India's best interest to continue investing in Russian equipment: US
363.article_body: US Defence Secretary Lloyd Austin said on Tuesday that it expects India to scale down its dependence on Russian military equipment. "We continue to work with them (India) to ensure that they understand that it's not in their...best interest to continue to invest in Russian equipment," Austin told the members of the House Armed Services Committee during a Congressional hearing.

364.title: We are desi: Abhishek recalls his reply to Oprah about him living with parents
364.article_body: Actor Abhishek Bachchan, who appeared alongside his wife actress Aishwarya Rai in an episode of The Oprah Winfrey Show in 2009, recalled the response he gave to the host Oprah Winfrey when she was amazed by the concept of children continuing to live with their parents even as adults. He said, "It was a big deal for her...We are desi."

365.title: Reduce import duty on newsprint: Sushil Modi tells Centre
365.article_body: BJP MP Sushil Kumar Modi urged the Centre to reduce import duty on newsprint to help revive the newspaper industry, which is impacted due to supply shortages of newsprint amid Russia-Ukraine crisis. "India is extremely reliant on newsprint import and is the largest importer of newsprint globally, importing 45% from Russia alone," he said. "Newspapers...are essential for democracy," he added.

366.title: Ivanka Trump testifies before House panel on Jan 6 Capitol attack
366.article_body: Ivanka Trump, daughter of former US President Donald Trump, testified for about eight hours via video-conferencing before the House panel probing the Capitol attack on January 6 last year. "She's answering questionsâ€¦ not in a broad, chatty term, but she's answering," said Representative Bennie Thompson. "She came in on her ownâ€¦ We did not have to subpoena," he added.

367.title: Dentist in Chhattisgarh cheated of â‚¹81 lakh in Chinese 'pig butchering' crypto scam
367.article_body: A dentist has been cheated of â‚¹81 lakh in Chhattisgarh's Rajnandgaon district in a Chinese 'pig butchering' crypto scam. A woman named Anna Li, suspected to be from Hong Kong, befriended the dentist and lured him into investing in crypto with a promise that he'd get three times returns, police said. This is first such case in Chhattisgarh, police added.

368.title: Russian troops no different from terrorists: Ukraine Prez
368.article_body: The actions of Russian troops were no different from terrorists such as Daesh, said Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy while addressing UNSC on Tuesday. "Russia's actions in Ukraine have resulted in the most terrible war crimes of all times we have seen since the end of World War II," he added. He further demanded that Russia be expelled from UNSC.

369.title: Karthik came in and just took the game away: RR's Riyan on defeat
369.article_body: Talking about their first defeat in three games this season, RR batter Riyan Parag said RCB's Dinesh Karthik came in to bat and took the game away from them. "I don't think we made a lot of mistakes...I just feel they were better on the given day," he added. RCB chased down RR's 169-run total with five balls to spare.

370.title: Next project is controversial; it'll be more violent than Squid Game: Director
370.article_body: Director Hwang Dong-hyuk, who directed the Korean language series 'Squid Game', said he is working on a film titled 'Killing Old People Club'. Hwang added that he has already penned a 25-page treatment about 'Killing Old People Club' which is bound to be "another controversial" project.  The director further said that the film will be more violent than 'Squid Game'.

371.title: IIT-D, Delhi Jal Board sign MoU to address water security issues
371.article_body: Indian Institute of Technology-Delhi (IIT-D) and Delhi Jal Board (DJB) have signed an MoU to address issues related to water security in national capital. As part of MoU, both sides will work on identifying research and development initiatives in water supply and distribution, wastewater conveyance, recycling and disposal. They will also develop Smart Operation and Management framework for DJB.

372.title: CNG price in Delhi hiked by â‚¹2.5 per kg, to now cost â‚¹66.61 per kg
372.article_body: The Indraprastha Gas Limited (IGL) has hiked the price of Compressed Natural Gas (CNG) in Delhi by â‚¹2.5 per kg from Wednesday. CNG will now cost â‚¹66.61 per kg in the national capital. For Noida, Greater Noida and Ghaziabad, the CNG price has been hiked to â‚¹69.18 per kg. In Gurugram, it has been hiked to â‚¹74.94 per kg.

373.title: People think he's a skinny guy, can't hit: Plessis on Shahbaz Ahmed's 45(26)
373.article_body: RCB captain Faf du Plessis praised all-rounder Shahbaz Ahmed for his 45-run innings against RR, stating that the 27-year-old will play a "long part" this season. "People think since Shahbaz is a small skinny guy, he can't hit it long but he can smash it a long way," added Plessis. Shahbaz smashed 3 sixes and 4 fours in his innings.

374.title: Voice votes taken 200 times during passage of CA Bill in Rajya Sabha
374.article_body: Rajya Sabha saw voice votes being taken over 200 times for passage of a Bill on Chartered Accountants (CAs) on Tuesday. The debate on the Bill, including FM Nirmala Sitharaman's reply, took about two hours and 20 minutes and the process of voting took over 30 minutes. There were 106 clauses and clause-wise amendments in the Bill.

375.title: Eye-witness in Cong councillor Tapan Kandu's murder case found dead in WB
375.article_body: An eye-witness in Congress councillor Tapan Kandu's murder case was found dead on Wednesday in West Bengal's Purulia, police said. He was found hanging from the ceiling in his house, police added. The deceased left a note which stated, "I've been under mental stress since the day I saw Tapan's death...mental stress is aggravated by the repeated calls from police."

376.title: Told myself 'you'll go doing what you love': Tanuj on 'near-death experience'
376.article_body: Actor Tanuj Virwani said he felt "close to death" while filming underwater sequence during shoot for Abhay 3. "[Divya Agarwal] would be all 'We got this bro'...I would say yeah but in my head...I was thinking...'I don't know what's happening'...I just told myself, 'If this is how you have to go...at least you'll go doing something you love'," he added.

377.title: UK claims to have frozen $350 billion of Putin's war chest
377.article_body: British Foreign Secretary Liz Truss on Tuesday said that the UK has frozen $350 billion of Russian President Vladimir Putin's war chest following the attack on Ukraine. "Our sanctions have had a crippling impact on those who feed and fund Putin's war machine," she said during her Poland visit. She added the sanctions are hurting the Russian economy.

378.title: Trump's supporters urge Musk to bring him back on Twitter
378.article_body: Former US President Donald Trump's supporters are urging Tesla CEO Elon Musk to reinstate Trump's Twitter account after Musk became Twitter's largest shareholder. "Now that...Musk is Twitter's largest shareholder, it's time to lift...political censorship. Oh...and BRING BACK TRUMP!" Republican Lauren Boebert tweeted. Trump was permanently banned from Twitter following the US Capitol riot in 2021.

379.title: Mumbai gets its first transgender toilet in Goregaon
379.article_body: Mumbai's first public toilet exclusively built for the LGBTQ community has been set up in the Goregaon area. The project aims to provide a safe space for transgenders and prevent gender discrimination against them. "We request the government to construct more toilets like this one in other areas of the city," an LGBTQ member Manju, said while welcoming the move.

380.title: Electricity charges to increase in Bengaluru as KERC hikes tariff
380.article_body: The electricity charges for people living in Bengaluru will now increase as the Karnataka Electricity Regulatory Commission (KERC) announced a 35-paise-per-unit increase in electricity tariffs for the next fiscal year (2022-23). "Against the demand of â‚¹1.85/unit by electric supply companies, the commission has increased the tariff by five paise per unit," Commission Chairman HM Manjunatha said.

381.title: Court denies bail to Jamia student in Northeast Delhi riots case
381.article_body: A Delhi court has denied bail to Jamia Millia Islamia student Meeran Haider in connection with a case related to 2020 Northeast Delhi riots. Haider, who is a Rashtriya Janata Dal youth wing leader, was charged under UAPA and sections of IPC. There are reasonable grounds for believing that the accusation against him is prima facie true, the court ruled.

382.title: Residents dump sewer waste at councillorâ€™s office over inaction in Ludhiana
382.article_body: The residents of Ludhiana's Manjit Nagar dumped sewer waste in the office of Ward 47 Congress councillor Priya Kaira alleging inaction over multiple complaints. They were protesting against choked sewer lines in the area, which they claim had not been cleared out in four years. "One cannot even move through the streets due to the accumulated wastewater," a protestor claimed.

383.title: Amid Azaan row, B'luru Police starts seizing mics from places of worship
383.article_body: Amid the ongoing controversy around using loudspeakers for Azaan, Bengaluru Police have started seizing microphones from places of worship that allegedly defied noise pollution orders of court. Bengaluru Police Commissioner Kamal Pant said that the police have booked cases and that the drive will continue to keep a check on prescribed decibel levels. He also said action will be initiated.

384.title: Had 4 months of training, spent 4-5 hrs a day playing cricket: Shahid on Jersey
384.article_body: Actor Shahid Kapoor said that he underwent four months of training for his upcoming film 'Jersey'. "We started in Bombay and began playing on hard surfaces. We started with throwdowns. I used to spend four-five hours a day playing cricket for four months and then [a lot] on set [too]," he added.

385.title: Vidya would say a line, go to a room and have tears: Director on 'Jalsa' scene
385.article_body: 'Jalsa' director Suresh Triveni said that actress Vidya Balan cried after filming a scene that involved her yelling at her on-screen son. "Every time Vidya would say that line...she'll...come near the monitor, go inside a room...she would have tears...I remember when I met Surya later after the shoot, and the first thing he said was 'Vidya ma'am cried," Suresh added.

386.title: Karthik shifted momentum our way, it made it easy for me: Shahbaz
386.article_body: RCB all-rounder Shahbaz Ahmed, who scored 45 off 26 against RR, has said the wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik shifted the momentum in the game with his 23-ball 44-run innings and it also made it easy for him to bat. "The situation was a little tough because the momentum was with RR...But DK bhai shifted the momentum," he stated.

387.title: 48,000 mask-less Punekars penalised, â‚¹1.90 crore fine collected in 2 yrs
387.article_body: Over 48,000 people were penalised for flouting COVID-19 mask rules in the last two years in Pune. Reports said that â‚¹1.90 crore fine was collected in two years. The penalties included people who were caught spitting on the roads. Officials said that the highest imposed penalty during the pandemic for these offences went up to as high as â‚¹1,000.

388.title: Hrithik, rumoured girlfriend Saba party with Sussanne and Arslan in Goa, pics surface
388.article_body: Actor Hrithik Roshan and his rumoured girlfriend Saba Azad partied together with Hrithik's ex-wife Sussanne Khan and her rumoured boyfriend Arslan Goni in Goa. Pooja Bedi shared pictures from the party, which also saw Sussanneâ€™s siblings Farah Khan Ali and Zayed Khan in attendance. Hrithik and Sussanne had tied the knot in 2000 and had separated in 2014.

389.title: Am I Vijay Mallya or Nirav or Ambani, Adani: Raut mocks ED for attaching his property
389.article_body: After ED attached Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut's properties in a â‚¹1,034-crore land scam case, he mocked the agency, saying, "Understand the meaning of property. Am I Vijay Mallya, am I Mehul Choksi?" "Am I Nirav Modi or Ambani, Adani? I live in a small house. I don't have a single acre of land in my native place," he added.

390.title: 24-yr-old Army aspirant runs 350 km in 50 hours from Rajasthan to Delhi, clip goes viral
390.article_body: A 24-year-old Indian Army aspirant named Suresh Bhichar ran 350 km in 50 hours from Rajasthan to Delhi. "I have come from Rajasthan's Nagaur district. I have a passion to join the Indian Army," he said. He added, "Recruitment hasn't taken place for 2 years. I have come to Delhi by running to increase the enthusiasm of youth."

391.title: China reports 20,472 daily COVID-19 cases, highest since start of pandemic
391.article_body: China reported 20,472 new COVID-19 cases on Tuesday, the highest daily tally since the start of the pandemic. Shanghai remains the hotspot for the current surge, despite a sweeping lockdown of its 25 million people. There were 311 local infections and 16,766 asymptomatic cases in Shanghai, and another 973 infections and 1,798 asymptomatic cases in Jilin, a northeastern province.

392.title: Pak PM's wife's friend flees amid corruption charges; her '$90,000-bag' pic goes viral
392.article_body: A friend of Pakistan PM Imran Khan's wife Bushra Bibi has reportedly fled to Dubai amid allegations of corruption. A photo of Farah Khan travelling in luxury, with a bag near her feet, surfaced on Twitter, however, its date isn't clear. "The bag with her is for $90,000," Pakistan Muslim League-Nawaz Member Romina Khurshid Alam tweeted, sharing the picture.

393.title: Railways to begin Bengaluru to Tumakuru MEMU train services from April 8
393.article_body: The South Western Railways will run Mainline Electric Multiple Unit (MEMU) trains on Bengaluru-Tumakuru line from April 8 to facilitate office-goers, officials said. "The train will leave from Tumakuru at 11:15 am and arrive at Krantivira Sangolli Rayanna at 1:25 pm and depart from KSR at 1:50 pm and arrive at Tumakuru at 3:40 pm," a Railways officer informed.

394.title: Congress, that imposed Emergency, is crying for democracy today: Shah
394.article_body: Home Minister Amit Shah, while addressing the House over the Delhi Municipal Corporation (Amendment) Bill, 2022, said, "Congress, the party which imposed the Emergency, snatched all democratic rights, sent Opposition behind bars for no reason, strangled freedom of the press, and censored Kishore Kumar's songs, is crying for democracy today." He added that those who forget history, become history.

395.title: Criminal arrested with AK-47, 1,300 cartridges in UP's Shamli
395.article_body: Shamli Police in UP arrested a man from the Thanabhawan areaÂ and recovered an AK-47 rifle along with 1,300 rounds of cartridges which the accused bought forÂ â‚¹11 lakh. He is a member of 'Anil Banjiâ€™ gang. "The arrested criminal is being interrogated to know how a weapon like AK-47 was smuggled and from where," Shamli SP, Sukirti Madhav, said.

396.title: Haryana CM Khattar withdraws VVIP number series from his convoy
396.article_body: Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar on Tuesday announced the withdrawal of VVIP number series 0001 of four vehicles of his convoy. All the numbers will be available for the general public through e-auction, he added. "A revenue of â‚¹18 crore will be earned through e-auctioning...The money can be used for the welfare of the public," Khattar stated.

397.title: 2 arrested for assaulting, looting BSF sub-inspector in Gurugram
397.article_body: Two men were arrested on Tuesday for allegedly assaulting and looting a BSF sub-inspector. According to DCP Virender Vij, the suspects had offered a lift to sub-inspector Arvind Bagaria to drop him to Delhi. However, when they reached near Guru Dronacharya Metro station, one of the suspects moved to the back seat, assaulted Bagaria and looted his luggage, police added.

398.title: 5 domestic workers steal cash, jewels from employer's farmhouse in Ludhiana
398.article_body: Five domestic workers reportedly fled with cash and valuables worth lakhs from their employer's farmhouse in Ludhiana's Sarabha Nagar Extension while they were on a pilgrimage. "The accused...broke open the iron grill and glass of the store...broke the safes and stole cash...gold and silver jewels," the complainant said. According to police, the businessman had hired them two years ago.

399.title: New range of Hitachi split ACs comes with ambience light feature & Wi-Fi
399.article_body: Hitachi's new range of split ACs with advanced Japanese technology are unique and inspired by nature, stated the brand. The ACs are equipped with an immersive display called ambience light, which turns blue at a temperature of 16-23â„ƒ  indicating cool ambience, green at 24-27â„ƒ for comfort and red at 28-32â„ƒ to indicate warm ambience.

400.title: Gadkari, Raut, Maha MLAs attend dinner at Sharad Pawar's home in Delhi
400.article_body: BJP leader Nitin Gadkari, Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut and Maharashtra MLAs attended dinner at NCP chief Sharad Pawar's residence in Delhi. Pawar invited Maharashtra MLAs for the dinner, as the leaders from all the parties are in Delhi for a training program in Parliament. The MLAs also attended a tea party at Raut's residence in the evening.

401.title: I can't point out one moment where we lost the game vs RCB: Sanju Samson
401.article_body: RR captain Sanju Samson said he can't point out "one moment" where they lost the game against RCB on Tuesday night. "I thought it was a great effort to put up that total on such a slow wicket...Jos and Hetmyer batted brilliantly at the death," he added. This was RR's first loss in three games so far in the tournament.

402.title: Pune University students to get training as tour guides at Buddhist sites
402.article_body: Students at Savitribai Phule Pune University (SPPU) will get training and on-field experience of working as tour guides at Buddhist archaeological sites. The Department of Archaeology and Museums, Pune has agreed to provide training to students enrolled in postgraduate diploma course of Buddhist Heritage and Tourism. About 10 students in the first batch will be doing a three-month internship.

403.title: Man forces lover to sell house, threatens to leak intimate videos in Pune
403.article_body: A 40-year-old woman has lodged an FIR with Pune Police, stating her father's friend who was in relationship with her since 2012, forced her to sell her house and siphoned off money. She also stated that he made videos of their intimate moments and later used them for blackmailing her. The accused reportedly threatened to post videos on social media.
